author: {'steamid': '76561197994085641', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1621795373}
review:
A brilliant sequel that takes everything good about The Legend and polishes it up to make slightly better. Amelie makes a highly likable (if a bit fan-servicy) protagonist, while the new world, with its 14 islands to explore, provides a great collection of colorful settings that always keep things fresh. The writing confidently continues with its charming storybook tone but also delivers bits of solid worldbuilding like dimension-hopping demons or that unexpectedly creepy Zilgadis boss. The combat is varied, tight and (depending on your experience with turn-based tactics) can get pretty challenging even on Normal, but it is never unfair.

This particular version is an enhanced re-release of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/3170]Armored Princess[/url]. However, the og game is perfectly fine to play too, if it happens to be lying somewhere in the depths of your Steam library; the difference is relatively minor.

Considering how the following two games turned out, this is the clear peak of the series, and it should be savored accordingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010134534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 11120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11120, 'last_played': 1577891946}
review:
A very fun and lengthy game with a battle system known from the "Heroes of Might and Magic" series. 

The main reason why I loved this one so much is that it is not a RTS-like game like those where you'll have to compete in a race with your opponents but rather you can take your time and build up a strong army and character at your own leisure, experiencing everything and fighting a lot of battles. That's not to say that it is easy, just that it is a different focus from the base-grabbing HoMM-series which for me at least is very welcome as I like singleplayer best and the RTS genre is a little too competitive/multiplayer based for my taste.

The story is a little chaotic and the writing not so great, I'll admit that. But good enough to string you along.

The extremely good variation and number of maps/places you'll visit is one of the main reasons why I liked the game. You can be sure you'll encounter every enemy you can imagine in a Tolkien-like universe. And you can change your army accordingly throughout the game.

The XP/Leverup system works well and gear/inventory is not cluttered. Some of the abilities/spells you'll get are very fun and there is also a dragon which works as a kind of secondary spellbook, albeit with long cooldowns initially.

The bosses are cool and varied. There are not a lot of them but when you finally meet one, it will be a cool battle.

I can recommend the game strongly for all fans of tactical games and especially those who enjoy HoMM but would like a slower pace. Do NOT play King's Bounty 2 as it is very poor compared to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072880246', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2423, 'last_played': 1621768041}
review: It has been a long time since I finished this game, and I remember that I forgot to write review in some of the King's Bounty games. This one was particulary longer than any other King's Bounty that I ever played (warrior of the north might be longer since I am still playing again). So, for the first time there was some places that I wanted to avoid to keep the game shorter as I wanted to play other ones, but still it will be the first game that I will return (expect legend, which will be the best for me) due to the some not digested content in my perspective, and take it slow for this time to enjoy the %100 of the game. Still, may not be the most highlighted game on the series, but I suggest you to play it when you have some time distance from the last time you play a King's Bounty or similiar type of game.

review: Awesome Strategy RPG & King's Bounty game! Really as "perfect" of a game or SRPG as you're going to find imo, has so many cool, satisfying features and really fun combat. Lots of lore & story, great character development on the RPG side and tons of fun units to try in combat, Crossworlds really has it all. Def worth playing over Armored Princess since it has the awesome Orcs On The March expansion!

review:
I can see why it would look appealing, but after you've spent hours playing the Armored Princess, it's extremely discouraging to have to play it all over again, just to see the differences this expansion brings.

So, instead of fixing the original game they decided to make a standalone expansion that contains within itself the original Armored Princess. Just to have a reason to ask the people for more money.

I cannot respect this, respectively, I cannot recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198349082013', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3275, 'last_played': 1699466235}
review:
Best Kings bounty game for sure (yet)! If you like stategy games, this is a game you NEED to play!

Cozy enviroment with lots to do. Lots of troops with different syngergies and abilites, tons of spells to enhance your combat, and you get a PET DRAGON!

The constant feeling of progress with unlocking new islands and getting more and new troops is great. 

Not to mention feeling of clearing your first island of the playthrough or finally killing that boss that's been scaring you for the last 10 hours is just unmatched for me in gaming. 

I can't stress enough how perfectly they created progression in this game. You start off on a small island with some enemies that are pretty easy to beat. Eventually you will come across a map to a new island (!). You get there and everything is super scary. So you travel back, get stronger until you can fight your way onto the new island. You find a new map, this repeats etc.

This system might sound repeditive but it really doesn't feel like it when playing. You will constantly have a goal (clearing out this island, beating that boss or whatever), when you beat the goal you will already know what your next goal is since the game shows you what you will be able to explore when getting stronger.
(And of course, if you want some easy access to that island, just kite ;) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198122569990', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 3230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3230, 'last_played': 1672359461}
review:
Crossworlds was the first King's Bounty game I played, and it introduced me to this style of gameplay. Up to that point, I hadn't really played a game like it, and so it was a brand new experience. It took a little bit to learn the ropes, but once I did, I had loads of fun.....up until a certain point. See, the problem I've always had with the King's Bounty games, and especially the later entries in the series, is the insane difficulty spikes. This game is ridiculously hard on normal difficulty, much less playing on hard or insane. It tricks you by having the beginning islands very very easy and then all of a sudden you are getting roadgraded in Montero. 

This game is also way too long. It turns into a massive, repetitive slogfest the further you get into the game and the larger the enemy armies get. The gameplay isn't enjoyable enough to warrant the game being as long as it is. Especially since, in my opinion, the gameplay gets worse as the armies get bigger. The most enjoyable part of this game is the beginning because every thing is in small scale and losing a unit matters. Later on, you just commit genocides in your spare time, without even batting an eye. The gameplay itself is basically identical to Legend with a few UI upgrades and added units. The problem is that Legend was already really challenging, so by fucking up the balance, it makes the game painful to play at times.

I have no idea how people think that this is the best King's Bounty game since I found this game to be less enjoyable than even Legend was and far worse than the next 2. The balance is awful, significantly worse than Legend. The game itself drags on into eternity. The story is a downgrade. It just isn't as good of a product as Legend was or the games that follow it, and for that reason, I can't recommend it. Go play the King's Bounty games, they are all better than this one.

Final Grade - 4/10 - Outclassed By The Rest

author: {'steamid': '76561198209068469', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5064, 'last_played': 1687317782}
review: I hate to give this game a negative review since I really loved the legend. The quests and the whole feel of this game feel a bit bland compared to the legened. The big issue with this game for me is the balance, and I'm playing on normal. I managed to get to Verona with minimal losses to enemy's that were labeled hard or very hard and most enemy's were. I have the medal for 50 fights with no loses, but I'm at a point on the game were most islands just have people set at invincible I can still beat them but I loose like 25% of my army. Im not sure if I'm unlucky but most shops in the game are selling really shitty units never had this issue in the legend. I could probably keep going but I'll run out of good units pretty soon. I'll play this game a bit more but it seems pretty unfair at this point I have neural casters completely ignoring my fodder units even if they are right in front of them and killing my good units with spells, and heroes casting Armageddon after there 3rd deamon of phenex spell. I'm not sure why this game is said to be the best in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048844205', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3710, 'last_played': 1699414413}
review: I love this game. There's just something about this series, it's special. You'll not find anything with quite the same vibes. I personally think this is the most challenging of the series, while Warriors of the North is probably the easiest. If you're hunting around for something that has the combat of Heroes of Might and Magic 3 but adds a little something different to the overworld that you're not gonna find elsewhere in a game like this then this is really it, accept no substitutes. It's funny how a fairly low budget game out of russia from the 2000s has so much more personality and soul and fun than even passion projects by devoted and talented devs such as the Songs of Conquest devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015202980', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2364, 'last_played': 1398530770}
review: This isn't a Crosswords game. That is for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 448, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1488472705}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099272400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2724, 'last_played': 1681851319}
review: If you haven't played this game before, you should definitely try it. Especially if you are a fan of tactical combat, HoMM series specifically.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978600652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 5257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5257, 'last_played': 1625454075}
review: I'm kind of surprised I never wrote a review for this game in all the time I've owned it.  The short version is that of the King's Bounty series, I think that this one continues to stand up as the best one ever produced.  It has a lot of depth of features, highlights all the strengths of the series, has an interesting map and story to explore, and it's just fun.  It's a bit dated by modern standards but hasn't really be surpassed.  If you are willing to play a game for the experience and gameplay rather than modern graphics, Crossworlds is definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202174298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 4409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1699606744}
review:
I've played at least 150 strategy games and it's not an exaggeration to say KB: Armored Princess is top 5 at bare minimum. Armored Princess is the pinnacle of the entire King's Bounty series, and is among the best strategy games I've played. Honestly, you don't even NEED the Crossworlds expansion to enjoy Armored Princess, but the expansion is so cheap and adds quite a bit, so in many cases, you may as well get it.

Words can't really do justice to how good KB:AP is. It's GOAT material. It took all the goodies from The Legend, and some from the original MS DOS King's Bounty, then soared to even greater heights with it all. You still have randomization in troops and spell locations, leading to near-limitless replay value... and KB has been doing this decades before even XCOM Enemy Unknown, I might add! You now have some epic boss fights which are far beyond anything in The Legend. You can now sail between different islands and take on bounties, just like in the original King's Bounty. 

I'd also add that KB:AP is more difficult (and ergo, more fun) than The Legend. Enemies are more powerful, skill trees are balanced better, and the developers at Katauri had a generally better sense of what worked well. KB:AP doesn't really have any "cheese" strategies, and has a variety of structures in place which reward careful planning and precise tactics. The presence of high scores and the fan-favorite "no loss runs" allow for incredibly rich and interesting strategy that you see in hardly any other games. KB:AP is among the most robust and polished strategy games I've played, and has some of the greatest replay value too.

Crossworlds adds in 2 new mini-campaigns which are fun, and the "Orcs on the March" expansion. I admittedly haven't played around with the orcs too much, but this is yet another thing to spice up Armored Princess even further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170621723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 11646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 183, 'playtime_at_review': 9136, 'last_played': 1710886813}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970311162', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 11943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11456, 'last_played': 1667323898}
review: Other than the few cringeworthy things that are relics from when this came out (plate armor for men, bikini armor for women) this is still a great "My day at work sucked and I need to murder some hordes" kind of game.  Yes it is VERY repetitive but the constant battles fall in to a rhythm rather than being boring for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052256851', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2909, 'last_played': 1604109955}
review:
When you find out this game is the predecessor of heroes rather than the other way around... certainly not the experience you had in the other games, but an experience. story can mostly be skipped, but it does give you some information, though what it offers most is the grand diversity of units you can recruit and face off against. Send spiders and fish against demons, recruit orcs to dispatch on undead, curate a party of dragons to defeat pirates... sometimes there is synergy, but often there is not, though the army size limits really changes the game, making you really consider between mounds of weak units or a few strong ones. The dragon is certainly cute for such a force of destruction.

It's mostly an adventure, mostly a scripted one... like heroes, something I often wished of the other game to be.... just wander the lands with your huge armies, take on other armies or some ridiculous bosses, meet a great many people of diverse races and beliefs.... steal their money.

A game you can take at your own pace on tactical, turn-based army battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251770830', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5471, 'last_played': 1665500330}
review: A lovely game and the best of the whole franchise. I always like to come back to it, especially after they released this dreadful King's Bounty 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026941400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1525, 'last_played': 1663494015}
review: A very old school Heroes of might and magic style rpg. It's difficult to say how this game holds up for different people now a days, since its core gameplay is very grindy but still offers a lot of complexity and fun. Expect a 20-30 hour long open world campaign,  with a repetitive core gameplay but plenty of different play styles/talent trees to experiment, Pick this one up on sale and if you don't enjoy the first couple hours I'd just refund it, as the rest of the game is very much the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103358395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3087, 'last_played': 1660193369}
review:
9/10 - as good of an experience as I remember a decade ago
+ This is an enhanced version of King's Bounty: Armorer Princess. Shame publisher has not merged these versions
+ Expanded variety of troops from 'The Legend'
+ Bare bones serviceable story with memorable dialogue and quests
+ Great returning characters, 'story' progression
+ Gorgeous designs; beautiful eye candy in every piece of the world
+ Lovely exploration element of islands & charts before you can navigate to them
+ Excellent variety of tactics, spells, units
+ Nice 'xcom'-ish balance of strategy/overland map and localized tactics
+ Challenging; worthwhile to run around and avoid enemies to pick up powerups first or even better +XP/+Gold items/exploit re-playable item battles
+ Series is as good as HOMM at its best with its own signature

- Speed option removed; using config leads to instability and many crashes to fast forward fight animations (100s of restarts)
- Published version confusion

author: {'steamid': '76561198048717226', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 2626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2626, 'last_played': 1638089446}
review: This King‚Äôs Bounty pursues Amelie‚Äôs adventure to which her kingdom is attacked by demons, where we are sent to another world in search of someone. However this version compared to King‚Äôs Bounty: Armored Princess has a few more extras and an expansion to play, but with the same story. Compared to the previous volume, the gameplay doesn‚Äôt change much, where we have to form our team in order to progress in the game, having several side quests to do, which is a great way to evolve the character without having too many problems. There are 3 classes and with several spells to choose from, several companions to accompany us, among other things. If you like the Heroes of Might & Magic franchise genre, I think you will like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168372031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5019, 'last_played': 1647503541}
review: Lo puedes jugar durante horas y no te aburres ni un poco

author: {'steamid': '76561198273254344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1645383675}
review:
Very difficult to review because I *really* want to give it a thumbs up. But there are three main things that absolutely destroy the experience:

1. Even with combat speed turned up all the way, combat is painfully, painfully slow.
2. No sound effects during battle. It's so weird to have music drone on and on but nothing makes any sounds when it attacks or gets hit. Other parts of the game are so polished, but when it comes to combat - the main part of the friggin game - they couldn't be bothered to do any sound design at all? I don't get it.
3. Normal difficulty is simply too difficult.

On the other hand, I really like the graphics. The units and their abilities are well done. The dragon you get is awesome and adorable. But the negatives far outweigh the positives on this one, unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198868829295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1645162667}
review:
CAMERA VIEW

You can set the mini-map to rotate or set it fixed North. The world view, however, continuously rotates if you hold down the left mouse button to move. The only way it doesn't rotate is if you single click from place to place. This killed the experience for me before anything else.

You're walking through a forest with similar looking structures, trails, and trees, the camera is rotating, the mini-map is doing whatever it's doing, and at a certain point, you realize that you have no idea where you came from, where you're going or which general direction you're facing.

It would be much better if the camera could be set to fixed, if you could use the right mouse button to look around, and if the world view slowly rotated back to fixed North when you let the button go.

Even if you could fix the world view, you can't zoom out far enough, no matter how you rotate the camera. You always see more terrain North of the character and barely any terrain South of your character. So it's easy to walk into battles you don't mean to walk into.

VERY LIMITED AT THE BEGINNING OF THE GAME

You can only hold a certain amount of any troops. It's based on how high your Leadership is. It's very time consuming raising your leadership, especially considering that BECAUSE you have so few troops, you have to replenish them after every one or two battles. It doesn't matter if you have the resources to have 10 times as big of an army. You simply aren't allowed to use the resources that at your disposal.

This aspect of the game made me feel like I was playing a free game on a phone. As in, I started getting the feeling of anticipation that it was about to ask me to pay actual money to increase my leadership more quickly. It didn't, it just felt that way. It's just constant crawling through the game.

RAGE

You have Rage and Mana. Your Rage is for your dragon's skills, and it fills up when units in battle attack each other. The dragon skills seem to be some of the most useful and powerful skills at the very beginning.

If you fill up you're Rage, and win a battle, your Rage meter slowly depletes as you move across the open world. It was yet another thing making it seem like I was crawling through the game instead of progressing through the game.

ONE OF THE FEW GAMES THAT MIGHT MAKE YOU SICK

The only other games I experienced this with so far, are the Doom games. I've played FPS games before, but there's something about the Doom games specifically that makes me severely nauseous. For whatever reason, this game gives me the same feeling, although it's definitely not as bad as when I Play Doom.

FONT

Something games continue insisting on is making the Fonts up to 3 times smaller than they need to be. I couldn't find an option to change this, and this is something I know that many people agree on. Most people don't want to lean in, every time a huge block of text comes up.

On a related note, when you're talking to people in the open world, you might accidentally click on a building or a NPC. Doing this brings up a dialogue box with options. Instinctually, from playing other games, you'd think you can just click anywhere else on the world and move to that spot while the dialogue box is still up, but you can't. You have to click the option in the dialogue box that closes the dialogue box first.

CONCLUSION

The Heroes of Might and Magic games are some of my favorites. King's Bounty seems to draw inspiration them, if that's what you're looking for, but again, being so limited after being a few hours into the game, along with the other issues I listed above, it just kind of killed the experience for me.

I hope they update it with more options and settings that can enhance the gameplay experience for people different preferences.

review:
Bought it on sale for 3.74 USD, but it's certainly worth full price.  54 hours to get through the original campaign, then another 55 hours to get through the Orcs on the March expanded campaign.  If that's not good value for the money, I don't know what is.

I played this one back in the mid-2010s, it was the first one of this type of game I played.  Had a lot of fun with it then, and again this time around.  

Highly recommended!

review:
They don't make games like this anymore. A strict upgrade from Kings Bounty Legends, cutting some of the more annoying stuff while adding QOL improvements. The world is bigger, there is more of everything, but the game rests on a proven and well balanced foundation. Difficulty ramps up fast, buth things smooth out again once you mastered Verona and Monero. 

Crossworld = Armored Princess + Orcs on the March Expansion, so buy this instead of Armored Princess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991762192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 27995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2561, 'last_played': 1641780858}
review:
Great game.  For 11 years old, it still beats anything the HOM&M folks have put out in a decade.
  Essentially just a re-mask of KB:The Legend- but, with some simple adds:  A Pokemon-ish dragon just for the battle arenas, that gives a dedicated (and leveling) series of attack choices here and there, and some fresh lore and graphics (it can do 4k, without modding) from KB:TL.  But, yes- REALLY (even down to maps, hehe) more of a reboot of KB:TL.  
  The dragon is a great idea, and needs both power up points to activate (kindof like many abilities for characters) and levels up as you use it, with new ability choices and powerups.  LOVE it, though the Pokemon look is up to your personal choice- it feels a little odd within this genre.  But, good game add.
  Still- damned good fun, and I'm looking forward to KB2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046675266', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 1124, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1617511831}
review:
[h1]This is confusing as f*ck so I'm going to try my best to explain this...

Crossworlds comes with the expansion Orcs on the March AND the main game Armored Princess, so you don't need to buy that separately.
Choosing/switching between which game you'll play requires the game to restart, which ends up crashing every time and gives you a damn headache trying to force close it.

Crossworlds is the EXACT SAME game as Armored Princess just with extra content, so don't play Armored Princess first thinking the characters/main story is different!

I do recommend playing either one BEFORE the other extra two campaigns, as they do not have tutorials and throw you in to get butt f*cked!!!

Hope this helps.

7/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197980988967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 19433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15907, 'last_played': 1700201165}
review: This game is a love letter to everything Turn Based, and the replayability is endless.   Truly a desert island game if ever there was one, I return to this again and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169085960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 22228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2070, 'last_played': 1704487229}
review:
I recommend this game because I enjoy playing it. If you liked King's Bounty: The Legend (KBTL) then you will probably like this game. Although, I am having a little difficulty adjusting to some of the changes. There are some changes that I really like, some that I don't like that much, and some that I am starting to appreciate as the game progresses.

There are a lot of new units to pick from and that can be hard to because you have a lot of choices, but it is nice that you start with 2 reserve slots automatically. Some tweaks have been made to some of the units and I still haven't experimented with the Adrenaline system that the orc units now use.

I also noticed that you can get higher level units very early and doing a zero loss game seems more difficult than in KBTL, but it might just be because I haven't experimented with the right units or skill increases.

I would guess that about 60% or so of the game is the same, meaning items, spells, units, mechanics, etc. But there are a lot of new items, spells, units, etc. too.

And you can't get to a lot of areas without managing to get Navigation scrolls, which are protected by tougher enemy units. The game is set up as a series of islands and you have to have a Navigation scroll to unlock each new island on the map, whereas in KBTL you could get to at least 4 different areas and run around enemies right from the start.

I do like that many of the quests that I have finished so far don't require me to go all the way back to the person who gave me the quest. They seem to just complete and give the reward when you take the last action.

In my first play through, with multiple restarts and experimentation, and about 34 hours of game time, I managed to reach Level 13 with only 3 combats and partially explore about 6 islands before I just couldn't get any more Navigation scrolls. Now I need to start fighting everything to get more experience before I can unlock other islands. You can get to a much higher level in this game too. And the runes that you get seem to be more consistent.

I haven't found any real bugs or had any game crashes yet. Just like KBTL, the game seems very stable. However, I have found a few inconsistencies between descriptions and game play. For instance, the description for Ghost Pirates seem to indicate that the unit will only discover a chest during battle if there isn't already a chest on the battle grid. But that doesn't seem to be the case. Every single combat I use the Ghost Pirates a new chest pops up, even if there was already a chest or chests on the battle grid. That might be a bug or it might just be a mistake in the description of the unit. Most examples of that I have seen is just poorly worded or unclear description text.

Again, I base my recommendation on whether I am enjoying the game, which I am. I like old school games the best so I am somewhat easy to please and I usually play with the sound turned very low so I don't care about musical score or sound effects.

Overall, I think if you liked KBTL, then you will probably like this game, but it might take a bit of adjusting to the changes. Just give it a chance and keep an open mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069730445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1630060099}
review:
I've played all King's Bounty games off Steam a couple of years ago, and always had a lot of fun. It's a quirkier Heroes of Might and Magic in a way, and thank god -- considering what the latest HoM&M franchise has had to offer.

Crossworlds is definitely my favorite, followed by the initial The Legend from this newer editions of KB. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044293868', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5249, 'last_played': 1611614077}
review:
A solid addition to the King's Bounty series. Definitely buy this instead of Armored Princess for all the extra features.

My favorite part was actually the Defender of the Crown minigame. Basically, you start on an island with randomized units and equipment to buy. Defeat the first enemy and new units and equipment become available to purchase. So on and so forth for a total of 6 battles. Each battle has its own theme that adds an extra challenge, such as enemy buffs and invisible traps.

Unfortunately, those 6 battles go by rather quickly, and it'll always be those same 6 arenas on every playthrough. I would love to see an updated version of this mode in a future game with randomized missions and a longer campaign (at least 10+ battles). I've always been a one and done for the main King's Bounty campaigns, but this would give the game a huge amount of replayability. (much like conquests in the game Northgard, for those who have played it)

I was never a huge fan of bosses, so the gladiator arena and its 8 extra boss fights didn't really appeal to me.

review: This version has armored princess, champion of the arena, defender of the crown and the improved version of armored princess with more items and what not. I played the armored princess for a bit but the story is kinda boring and uninteresting compared to the original. From what i saw online this is long for no reason. The other extra campaigns are short and meh. I liked the original more

author: {'steamid': '76561198027526022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 13644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9617, 'last_played': 1637362384}
review:
I've put 560+ hours into the king's bounty games, and i feel that I've played them quite casually, not seen everything or fought every battle.
They are a joy to play, and this is probably the best one, the one that is a pleasure for longest.
You can get it extremely cheaply if you wait for a sale, you can play it on a very low end machine.
It has a lot to recommend it, the unit variety, the writing, the feeling of riding a horse or piloting a ship.
Lovely game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 793, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1607226352}
review:
the game actually took quite a bit longer than it shows that I played because I played a lot of it offline because I had no internet

the game was just ok

a few cons that I came across was a few bugs such as when fighting the mech boss around turn 30ish the game stopped giving me rage and resupplying my mana (when I had the perk) which was really annoying and when I finally killed the boss  i only had my paladins left and he had the ranged droids so because they have 4 movement and paladins have 2 i moved close and they kept flying away and shooting me and I couldn't catch them (I was playing the spell class and the glitch wasn't giving me my mana every turn like it should) eventually the game gave me mana and I could kill them with spells but that was just annoying

some game mechanics not explained

the game is actually pretty hard even on easy difficulty at times (especially on boss battles because they take away the use of your dragon for no apparent reason)

there is a lot of text in this game a third of the way through I just didn't even bother with it and just started to click through the dialog as most of it was unimportant filler

it had good visuals, music and decent gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198026062605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13847, 'last_played': 1607286414}
review:
I have come in contact with kings bounty series via recommendation from a friend named Vlaho. I was sceptical at first when he explained me the game mechanics. I believe my doubt was generated by Heroes of might and magic/disciples series indoctrination. 
But after trying the game i quickly got hooked, and the game is different from HOMM, cannot be played in multiplayer, but is imensely better for singleplayer experience due to open world feeling with no scaling of monster strenght. Also the mechanic of leadership which determines the number of units you can lead is excelent as it prevents "massing" and numbers game.
I recommend the whole series, my personal best is kings bounty crossworlds.
Wonderful game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990055149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 11130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7630, 'last_played': 1696892563}
review: I think I have the most hours in this game of any Steam person outside of Russia.  It's my go-to when I just want to relax after a long day of work.  A great Hex game reminicent of the good old Heroes of Might and Magic before they started to suck.  At the time of my review, this game is ancient, but still worth playing IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143301338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3814, 'last_played': 1706308014}
review:
i have more hours in non steam version.
i don't finish games (mostly not) often and i finished this game a few time.
i play almost all heroes games (and a lot of time) but for me its what heroes should have been like for single player.

in this particular game there are islands where you can explore in own order .some will be your only option and some will be too tough but mostly you are free to explore and for me a big plus.

i like where in each place you can choose to buy the "local" troops and play as you wish and change it up a bit depends on your location or enemies.

there are many quests and very fun bonus battles. the dragon is a nice addition so you don't have to rely only on tour magic.  there are only 3 classes but you can mix it up for your play style, the main difference is that they all have 1 special skill and the amount of runes you get for a battle style (the will be used for upgrading skills.) 

the 2 biggest advantage compare to heroes is 
1. you can move and not end your turn, vert helpful if you want your range unit to make a range shoot when a melee unit is too close (or just prepare for a tactical play with a few troops)
2. you can't have as much units as you want. you have a certain leaderships that depends or your level, class, items and other things. that make it very fun and harder to become too boring, example - wizard at the end can cast 2 spells in one turn but can't have many troops so he is very balances.

i like both heroes and king's bounty series. they are very much a like but also can be very different.

if you like heroes and want a more single player focus this is the game for you (it's not the newest but it's the best one so far)

author: {'steamid': '76561199006010157', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1694124830}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966228761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5006, 'last_played': 1672872579}
review: Can be hard AF and even impossible if you don't plan your army/strategy correct.  Often times I've found myself running ahead to other areas to grab the goodies earlier than I'm supposed to, only leaving out things i can't reach through the high level mobs, so that when I return to my normal level place, I have an edge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990994295', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 10147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9949, 'last_played': 1594071397}
review:
The most accomplished game of the series, lore, combat, some exploration, humour, progression, it has them all.

However, the constant need to replenish troops after almost each battle is exhausting and makes the game extremely repetitive. Even resuscitating spells doesn't help much. You'll find yourself going to find fresh troop all the time. Which means a second playthrough is not an option. This is a glaring and heavy fault. The game is still worth being played once.

review:

But you can still dabble in one or the other regardless

author: {'steamid': '76561198239245276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3391, 'last_played': 1594146050}
review: If you like tactical rpgs, you'll love this game/series. Many of the aspects of KB: The Legend are improved upon in this game and I would also highly recommend you get the Crossworlds expansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141926156', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1598292637}
review:
Just "Armored Princess" with few new quests and some artifacts.
"New Campaigns" they said. Just unfair fights with bosses from Armored Princess. Not sure why this should be fun to have 500-1000 leadership (on easy) and try to fight boss 2400hp, damaging like 80-200 in first round. After it - mass damage every round. So you win, go re-buy your troops and again the same.
On higher difficulties it's just almost the same but boss get 5100hp and you have less leadership.

Strange solution. So 4 campaigns: original AR, Arena, Arena "v2", and extended AR.
Worth to buy if you do not own AR yet. That's why negative review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160472073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 9042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4197, 'last_played': 1603292275}
review:
Essentially- a well-balanced Armored Princess with some extra sauce.

Additional content: 
1)Two relatively short campaigns that really don't provide anything interesting or challenging. One of them is a sandbox arena, and the other one- is a scuffed version of said arena featuring Princess Amelie and better fights.

2)Orcs on the March:
-A new boring quest with an incredibly challenging fight at the end.
-Literally- tons of new items and the artifact mechanic, when you combine certain items together to form an overpowered relic that takes up only one slot of equipment.
-Relatively sizeable amount of changes to the talent trees, so other classes won't be so much worse than the Mage.
-Massive overhaul of orcs and introduction of Adrenaline, that makes most of their units relatively overpowered in most of the scenarios. 
-Large amount of changes to the original units and introduction of a few extras.
-Changes to the spellbook that balance some of the more mediocre spells and bring back the abilities of the Spirits of Rage from the first game in form of usable spells.

*)Side note- Moro Dark is even more overpowered compared to the Armored Princess.- 

OOM: 9/10. Rest: time consuming bullshit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128951166', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6229, 'last_played': 1704835319}
review:
A bit hard for players who never played HOMM. The control and UI is bit awkward in year 2020.

But the game is generally playable for old HOMM players. I spent a few hours playing it every day recently and found it's entertainable. I bought the bundle package when it's on sale and plan to play all DLCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019576097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 4414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4414, 'last_played': 1587346848}
review:
[h1]The trailer for King's Bounty 2 set me in the mood[/h1]

Some years ago I discovery the first King's bounty game, during my nostalgia search for more classic might and magic universe ( For blood and honor, how I love you!). And I had a blast! So of course I bought the expansion, but never played till now, and I must say this is better in every single way. This might have been a little more difficult than The legend, or maybe I'm getting too old...

Perfect to kill a lot of time during the quarantine!

Also, ignore Armored Princess, this version includes the original game and all expansion!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057103167', 'num_games_owned': 3580, 'num_reviews': 782, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1586383228}
review:
King's Bounty Crossworld est la version complete de King's Bounty Armored Princess avec trois add-on 
L Interet reste le meme que le jeu eponyme mais le resultat est vraiment simpa car outre les missions avec la princesse , vous avez droit a une mission a travers des arenes de challenges , une  campagne avec des orcs et la fin de la campagne de King's Bounty Armored Princess ! Du tres bon travail mais malheuresement TOTALEMENT en anglais !
A part ce detail , vous serez pret a reprendre du service pour de longues heures dessus !

Interet : 13/20
Realisation : 15/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198425462345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1586235794}
review:
I'm not sure why the reviews are so positive. This is HoMM with all the base-building elements ripped out, abysmal writing, and a very a grindy overall feel. 

There is a huge diversity of units and character customisation options, but they do not make up for the core game play being boring. Titles like this need either deep combat, strategic elements, or compelling exploration, but King's Bounty delivers none of these.

Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153316606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1583456355}
review: Nice turn based game. Buy Crossworlds as it comes with another free game: Armoured Princess. Armoured Princess is the hardest out of all the Kings Bounty games. To beat Armoured princess go with Palladin as you get fire blast. Choose any dragon you like the colour of, but get the chest treasure hunt with your dragon as soon as you can when you upgrade the Dragon. this way you build cash/coin. i chose the red Dragon for hit points. Dont upgrade your weapons (you go to crazy stage and get killed) and don't sell them you will meet the odd companion to give them to. A good old school turn based game that still plays good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986503468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2305, 'last_played': 1590020863}
review:
Outstanding game play and visuals, especially at the price; I picked this up on sale but would have gladly paid full price or more.  Great fantasy/medieval setting with lots of variety.  Plays like a $40+ game.  

As a veteran gamer of some 25 years, I don't find many titles that can pull me in and keep me hooked.  I've been playing it nonstop daily for 3 weeks.

This package includes Armored Princess (I'm not even halfway through the campaign at 38 hours) and a series of expansions.

review: Crossroads of Worlds is an addon that adds a little new to the well-known old - the Princess in Armor game. In addition to the usual set of new items / units / artifacts / buildings for such additions, the possibility of improving troops has been added, now there is no need to hang around castles, leaving unnecessary armies in garrisons, they can be improved and used more effectively. The company has added a story about the campaign of the orcs, not that it greatly influenced the events, just brings a little variety, the Orcs in general have been greatly strengthened by them now you can fight with minimal losses in battles. In addition to traveling around Teana, there are 2 other small companies focused on tactics and knowledge of the game, they are small and unmemorable. I recommend it to all fans of King's Bounty and tactical fantasy strategies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018471649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8979, 'last_played': 1562438777}
review:
King's Bounty is an 1980s Franchise acquired and remade into a whole generation of turn-based strategy campaigns.  I find Crossworlds to be an improvement on baseline Armored Princess and the first in the series, The Legend.

The Good:  This is a highly polished iteration of the game, with a good level of difficulty.  The game heavily rewards adventuring, kiting foes and minimizing losses.  Because of the heavy randomness (your armies are recruited from randomly generated creatures and you fight partially random foes) there is some replay value.

I enjoy the soundtrack, the different threats posed by different armies.

The Bad:  
King's Bounty gets very grindy.  Fighting giant armies with your own giant armies doesn't lead to quick KO battles, it leads to long, drawn out positional duels which take a long time and basically end by attrition.

Another problem is a general lack of balance among spells, creature types and skills.  Put simply, given the choice you'd always run Royal Snakes (because they are pretty hardy and don't draw a retaliation when they attack).  You'd run Demonesses and the Sacrifice spell (because now you're killing enemy units and getting allied units) and you'd never run something pirates because they're too slow and can't get into the fight.

In the same way, you can get more crystals for your spellbook, or the power to cast things twice.

This isn't a deal breaker but it presents a different kind of problem for the game; you can optimize it and at that point, it loses a lot of luster because these ideas are how you win.

King's Bounty has a system of trying to rate the strength of armies but it falls apart as things like mobility and ranged attacks are not considered.  This ultimately leads to destroying 'impossible' armies by simply locking up the battlefield.

Ultimately, Kings' Bounty Crossworlds is fun in doses and people who like strategy will enjoy determining the best way to proceed.  Until the battles become gigantic, one hour long affairs, the gameplay includes bosses and difficult fights but they're enjoyable fights.  I don't recommend this to someone uninterested in strategy, but if that's your interest this game is worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052611809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1658604900}
review:
Als gro√üer Fan von Heroes 3, 4 & 5 hatte ich damals vorerst gro√üe Hoffnung dass Kings Bounty quasi als das Remake um die Ecke kommt und vieles noch besser macht.
Aber was passiert ist es macht nichts besser, sondern wirklich vieles g√§nzlich anderst.
Wo man jetzt vielleicht denken k√∂nnte: Na Toll, ich habe gehofft es ist wie die Heroes Reihe, muss definitiv folgendes gesagt sein:
Kings Bounty ist zwar ein dem Genre sehr √§hnlicher aber dennoch Komplett selbstst√§ndiger Titel der viele Systeme beinhaltet die wirklich die Langzeitmotivation hoch halten.
Kurz gesagt: 
Man steuert mit seinem Hauptheld √ºber sehr Stimmungsvolle Karten und Sammelt sogenannte F√ºhrungspunkte, die die Anzahl der mitf√ºhrbaren Kreaturen begrenzen. So ist man gewillt immer mehr davon zu sammeln und st√§rker zu werden.
Gleichzeitig Levelt man seinen Held und Verbessert dessen F√§higkeiten immer weiter.
Und zu guter letzt kann man auch noch je nach Kings Bounty Spiel z.B. einen Drachen, Geister, etc. Leveln die M√§chtige Zauber lernen und einen somit im Kampf gut unterst√ºtzen k√∂nnen.
Und fast h√§tte ich noch etwas vergessen: man kann auch mancherlei Artefakte durch K√§mpfe gegen sogenannte Wachter verbessern bzw. aufr√ºsten. Dadurch hat man immer mal wieder die Hoffnung die Waffe jetzt endlich weiter Aufr√ºsten zu k√∂nnen weil man ja ein paar F√ºhrungspunkte und Heldenlevel weiter ist.

F√ºr mich ein sehr geniales Spiel mit interessanten Kreaturen die sich teilweise sehr gut erg√§nzen und auch sehr Abwechslungsreiche Zauber f√ºr meinen Geschmack.
Immer wieder Spielbar und sein Geld Wert wem solche Spiele gefallen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189336947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1565500798}
review:
I already had the Armored Princess before I purchased Crossworlds.

I knew Crossworlds includes the expansion of Armored Princess, but since it claims to come with two new campaigns, I thought it would still be worth the money.

I was wrong.

Those two campaigns barely have any new content. In the 1st one you fight various bosses in an arena in a dungeon. You don't even need a map because there is not much place you can go. You will be given a meager start up fund with a super low leadership (like 800), and all of your opponents in the arena are bosses (i.e., those single, huge guys in the Armored Princess). You might be able to raise the leadership to over 1000 by wearing some personal gears. Nonetheless, you can imagine how poor it looks to fight a boss with a leadership around 1000. You won't be able to enjoy your army killing the enemies like in the Armored Princess. Instead, you will see your units slaughtered by your enemy one by one, although in the end you might be able to win the boss fight.

In the 2nd campaign you fight the lizardman army, again in a pitiable start up condition. I didn't really play this campaign, as it looks just as disappointing as the 1st one.

I think this version of King's Bounty will be a good investment if you DO NOT have the original Armored Princess yet. Otherwise it would be a waste of money.

review:
It's like Mount & Blade, but not only do you have a horse, you also have a pet dragon! 
And battle is turned-based...
But you still get to command your own army!
And it looks a lot cuter, and a lot less blood...
But your enemies still look uglier then you!
And it has sort of a story even if it's not that original...
But it still has a lot of side quests that give you money!
And it is not about world domination but saving the world...
And it has magic...

Ok√©, maybe it's not like Mount & Blade at all, but still fun to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061780568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1561671162}
review:
Contient diff√©rents genres d'extension, en plus du jeu de base.
Si on a aim√© Armored Princess, c'est la continuit√© pour une des extensions. Pour une autre partie de Crossworld, c'est comme Armored Princess mais avec des qu√™tes en plus, des unit√©s et des items en plus... et un jeu int√©gralement en anglais. Si on franchit ce pas, c'est un excellent jeu !
Pour une derni√®re partie de Crossworld, c'est un combat de boss, en ar√®ne, terminable en une petite apr√®s midi mais donc rejouable facilement selon les 3 classes possibles et les unit√©s √† disposition.

Crossworld, c'est donc diff√©rentes mani√®res de jouer/rejouer le jeu de base Armored Princess avec des petits ajouts bien sympa √† condition d'√™tre √† l'aise en anglais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1553005226}
review:
Sigo enamorado de ‚ÄúLa generosidad del Rey". 
King's Bounty: Crossworlds es la continuaci√≥n del primer videojuego de la saga. Su jugabilidad se mantiene igual que su antecesor, batallas estrat√©gicas de tus ej√©rcitos pero a√±adiendo algunas novedades, por ejemplos‚Ä¶
1)	Casillas trampas en el campo de la batalla.
2)	Compa√±ero Drag√≥n. En tus batallas, ya no tendr√°s la ayuda de entidades, si no, de un drag√≥n, el cual podr√°s ponerle un nombre. En cuanto lo obtengas, podr√°s elegir su primera habilidad, yo recomiendo escoger la de ‚ÄúBusca Tesoro‚Äù. De esta manera, podr√°s obtener recompensas desde la primera batalla.
3)	Nuevos soldados a elegir para tu ej√©rcito, y nuevos enemigos contra los que luchar.
4)	Nuevos hechizos, armas y armaduras.
5)	La posibilidad de volar por el mapa.
6)     Super jefazos.
Su historia est√° muy bien trabajada, y mantiene el mismo tipo de humor. 
El videojuego ofrece a posibilidad de guardar partidas en la nube, y viene traducido completamente (Gracias FX Interactive y 1C Entertainment).
Aunque el juego es bueno, posee algunas pegas‚Ä¶
1)	No posee logros y cromos Steam.
2)	Las trampas en el campo de batalla, son repetitivas. Solo ves altas variaciones, en la miniaventura de la expansi√≥n.
3)	Soldados y enemigos limitados.
El King's Bounty: Crossworlds es en realidad una versi√≥n mejorada del King's Bounty: Armored Princess, del cual ofrece una expansi√≥n y adem√°s, ofrece la versi√≥n normal de esta √∫ltima.
Es por ello, que recomiendo NO COMPRAR el ‚ÄúKing's Bounty: Armored Princess‚Äù, y COMPRAR DIRECTAMENTE el ‚ÄúEl King's Bounty: Crossworlds‚Äù.
Te sugiero hacerte con la saga King's Bounty: Ultimate Edition, si la encuentras por 6¬¥12‚Ç¨ o por menos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043840291', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 4077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3122, 'last_played': 1667508612}
review:
It's a good tactical RPG game. Might be too big, maybe it becomes boring eventually, but it's fun.

If you played Heroes of Might and Magic then this is very similar. Instead of strategic competition with AI there's a big RPG world that you explore, master, clear out. The story and setting are whimsical, it's certainly more Pratchett than Tolkien.

The biggest problem with the game might be that it's not an episodic game, so to say. You might think that you can load it, play a couple of battles and switch to something else. But you have to learn the map, to master it. You have to remember who sells units you use to know or will use later to fill up your ranks regularly. You have to remember where have you seen an item that will work great with your new army or other artifacts. You have to remember where have you left some enemy armies that were too dangerous at the time. Eventually, you unlock dozens of maps and even if you completely clear the map you might still need to return to buy troops or items or something else. It's a great game if you're ready to play to master it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872817115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3787, 'last_played': 1547111590}
review: The first King's Bounty game that I finished. This is one of the best KB that I have ever played. The story is amazing with witty dialouge and the lands to explore are interesting and there are lots of stuff to do in them. I played with a Warrior class and the bosses are really exciting to fight against. The pet dragon that you recieve is probably one of my favourite things in this game. He is so overpowered for the warrior class and I will do a Mage and Paladin playthrough as well :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198162368960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 8089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1656398949}
review:
Mira, si te gust√≥ mucho King's Bounty: The legend, entonces no hay pierde: esto te va a encantar.
B√°sicamente es id√©ntico, pero con cositas agregadas. Es decir, trae casi todas las tropas de su precuela, y le a√±adieron varias m√°s muy interesantes. Mismo caso para las armas y objetos, los retratos de los personajes, hechizos, habilidades de furia, etc. Lo mismo, pero con cosas nuevas agregadas. Hasta la m√∫sica.
De igual manera, la interfaz es pr√°cticamente una r√©plica del anterior. 
¬øTodo esto es malo? Para nada. Todo lo del primer juego es incre√≠ble, y aqu√≠ lo potenciaron. Hay algunas sorpresitas, como que ahora hay cinem√°ticas con voz (en espa√±ol), o que en vez de guardianes de furia ahora tienes un muy simp√°tico dragoncito que te ayuda durante la batalla. 
¬øLo √∫nico malo? La rid√≠cula armadura de la princesa que nos obligan a traer: yo quiero jugar con una hero√≠na, no con una stripper. Una l√°stima porque el dise√±o de ella es lindo.

IMPORTANTE: Este juego YA contiene Armored Princess. NO LOS COMPRES POR SEPARADO. Una vez en el men√∫ principal, ELIGE LA CUARTA CAMPA√ëA, que ya contiene la original m√°s el agregado de Orcs on the march. NO juegues la primera campa√±a pues no contiene todo lo que t√∫ compraste (p√©simo dise√±o).

Crossworlds is a DLC of the Armored princess; in fact, I don't know why the Song of Ice and Fire can be integrated into the northern warriors. However, the Crossworlds and the Armored princess have to be separated.Maybe this way can make more money(XD)?
There is an improvement over the previous game‚Äî‚Äî Legend, adding new units, new magic, and naturally extending multiple different tactics. The entire game curve and task flow is more reasonable. The content of the expansion pack is also very interesting, it is more difficult which needs you to have a lot of skills and tricks . Although I claim to be a good SLG player, it takes a lot of work.
The short game time is because I have been investing in pirate version of software for hundreds of hours. If you need me to invest another hundred hours, I will probably not be able to hold it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103583987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3820, 'last_played': 1498528270}
review: Amazing game, did it when it first came out, and bought it back on steam for a re run, really amazing game. For maximum pleasure, and after a couple of runs, try the "no-wasted-troops" challenge, doing every battle without loss in the impossible difficulty. Every battle becomes a chess game, and it reminded me of the best times of HoMM. If you like tactical games, HoMM kind of lore (yeah, I know KB was released prior to HoMM, but eh!), and insane but fair (and rewarding) challenges, go on!

Twice) and completed it, massively enjoyed it like the others, you've easily got a good 30-40h of playtime if you blitz through on Normal difficulty, but as my played time reflects, there's significantly more than that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050444870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1705329101}
review:
Great game. Highly recomended to those who enjoy Heores of Might and Magic. It is,  basically, a turnless version of those games, with a bigger focus on the RPG aspects. 

It has some dated aspects and mechanics, such as the absence of a decent map to guide you and a way too compact inventory system. The battles are great though, with way more startegic options than the HoMM series offers.
The story of the game is uninteresting and forgetable. It serves more as an excuse to go questing around the map.

It is, on the overall, a very enjoyable experience, with high replay value. May not the be a game that entices you too much and keeps you thinking about it when not playing, but it sure is a good relaxing time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035532559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3851, 'last_played': 1340521200}
review:
King's Bounty games are a very good variation to the HoMaM 3 game - you just drop the boring part (useless city management or catching AI's heros randomly wandering on the map) and focus on the fun part (combat). Possibly the best tactical combat I have ever seen, with endless tactical possibilities giving the various unit abilities and spells (which are no boring "do 200 damage spells", but mostly various debuffs, which you need to use wisely to win).

This part is a slightly modified Armored Princes, which was the best game of the series, so if you have never played a KB game, this is the one you want to pick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033636240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1526124067}
review:
Although this seems to be the best critically acclaimed part of the series, I would still not recommend it as a game. 
I am a huge fan of fantasy, I am a huge fan of strategie and I played and loved the Heroes of Might and Magic games to the death, but... I still can't recommend it because of it's kinda grindy and repetitive gameplay and also for it's lack of informations to the player.
The key element of the game is basically to run around the world and to fight everything that comes in your path. 
That might be fun for the first few 5 hours but after that you just want a damn skip mechanic! And in difference to Heroes of Might and Magic, this game doesn't have one! Sure, after you've reached a certain army size, enemies will just run from you and you can autosolve the fight that way, but seriouesly, your army has to be huge for that to happend. Bigger than you can normally reach!
I mean, I like the exploration, I want to know what happens next but I don't want to spend literal hours of beating up trash just to find that out. This is probably a weird critic for fans of the series, because the fighting is probably the meat of the game for them... well and I can see why, it's not that I can't enjoy the fights but there just soooo many of them! And you have to play them all out! You can't just skip it.
When it comes to the lack of information, it's fairly simple what I mean: For example you can upgrade items. Nice! But to do so you have to fight the guardians of that items (ugh more fighting...). If you don't know that (and the game won't tell you this until much later in the game) you click on "upgrade", "fight the guardians" and are suddenly facing an enemy army that completly overpowers you. I was dumb enough to not save before that but luckily only lost about 5 minutes in the process of reloading an older savefile. Still: why does the game not give you a warning, saying: Beware, the enemies army is Invincible compared to your's. That would be nice, if you could at least get an indication of what you are about to face.
So on top of the grindy and repetitive fighting it's also a lot of trial and error. Which is fine, I usually don't mind that but in this case it just creates this really annoying mix of time-stealing gameplay features that dampen the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038030078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3018, 'last_played': 1640563923}
review:
good game

i really like the kings bounty series. i played the original on genesis a long time ago. the new ones are more like the heroes of might and magic games. they are not simple games, but they will give you a lot of gameplay time and replay value as there are 3 classes to try. everytime you start a new game there are different items and different troops. if you want a challenging but fun game give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960784323', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2396, 'last_played': 1516939798}
review:
To be brief, this game is Heroes of Might & Magic but without the town management. The spells and creatures are varied and unique, and the combat system has a rage mechanic that allows you to use your dragon to perform abilities in combat. It's fantastic in this regard.

This version has all the other King's Bounty games alongside, which makes it a great value, however it is *broken*. You can play the original "Armored Princess" campaign, but the other campaigns seem to CTD the game at start up. This is why I cannot recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029378436', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 9389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5010, 'last_played': 1602274717}
review:
If you are familiar with the Heros of Might and Magic game series you know what to expext: managing an army of creatures in several stacks and defeating enemy armies. Solving quests etc. The game rather strictly controls your expansian. Unless the HOMM games you are limited in how many creatures can be in each slot. This limit goes up when leveling and when collecting certain elements on the game world.

The good:

- nice graphic
- solid mechanics
- no time limit

The bad:

- irritating control of your hero on the world map. the compass rotates like there is no tomorrow and it takes quite some effort and concentration to move to the point you want to go to
- extremely long loading times for save game restores and changes to the map parts your are on as well as when you enter combat (this is bad because the game works by minimizing combat casualities and you will have to reload a lot)
 (i have the game on a onboard ssd and 16 gb ram so it really is bad)
- technical problems (i changed the "subgame type" on the crossworlds main menu and the game crashes now every time i load it, preventing me to play the game anymore...)

summary:
the game is not really bad but the problems with the loading times, the overland movement and the technical problems are just enough to prevent having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180534547', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4975, 'last_played': 1688929974}
review:
One of my favorite game. I used to play it a lot when I was younger. Such a low price for such a game. For a strategy/story rich games lover this is just perfect. It takes a lot of time to gather your warriors, though it's really fun. While playing the game, make sure you know exactly where the sellers are or else you will spend 30% of your time searching for the right sellers. Be aware of warriors conflicting with eachother, save your mana, do the tasks and you're good! 
10/10 game would buy it again for a 2x price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1512717046}
review:
Short forward: if you're not knowing what kind of game it is, go the last third of this review...

You know, in the early '90s, King's Bounty, along with Prince of Persia, Leisure Suit Larry, Sim City (optionally Civilization or Dune: the battle for Arrakis) and some more... was nearly at every PC around. Yeah. They just were there. Like Windows 95 went out a bit later with the Solitaire, Pinball, and Minesweeper.

Right now, the disassociation of human individuals gone further, and you can easily find many gaming people who never played anything that you did. I even forgot when I had started Minesweeper myself for the last time! In all that chaos, in all that variety of thousands of games on the market, I think we all should have some safe haven. Some basic ground, some core stuff on your hardware which you can play anytime, anyplace, and almost any mood and condition. The games that you can take with you on the long space flight, without the risk to blow your back, or the PC, or the entire spaceship. Which can entertain you 10 (at least 9) times out of 10.

I'm sorry for the intro this long. The point is... King's Bounty from Katauri might be just one of those "basic games". You can play it calm and easy, and even let it go to your little daughter, without the fear for her morale or brain cells. You can play it hard, earning the leading places in the charts, with a fantastic K/D score and all. Of all the titles which Katauri released by that name, Crossworlds is the most complete experience. So, if you don't want to buy them all in a bundle, I suggest go for Crossworlds. Or for the first title, the Legend, which is shorter, however.

Well... there's one thing I have to mention there. Just as with Stalker title, Clear Skies and Call of Pripyat - were just the addons to the basic game Shadow of Chernobyl, although in some aspects they had many enhancements. But not enough to call them "Stalker 2 and 3". The same, and even more obvious, go with the whole line of Katauri's King's Bounty. Crossworlds, basically, is the DLC for the DLC Armored Princess for the basic game King's Bounty the Legend. But all three were released and presented separately. And while it's fair for the Armored Princess - there was a new story, new mechanics and all... Crossworlds is just a bit upgraded Armored Princess, with the same main story, but some more quests, and two additional short arena modes. So, if you have bought and played through Armored Princess before, you'll be disappointed at this rip-off. However, if you haven't had such experience, and just want to choose the one of the whole King's Bounty line, without paying for the whole line... Well, with the Crossworlds you'll get the most of them all.

Oh, well. Finally. What's it all about? King's Bounty is a half-RPG, with one main character, riding on the map, talking to various NPCs, solving their quests, collecting artifacts and other prizes, and fighting all the injustice in the world (in case of this title - of the many worlds). The battles are another half of the game, they are turn-based, with many units at your hand, each of them with various powers and skills... And in that second half, all is looking much like glorious and legendary Heroes of Might and Magic... until you know the fact that original King's Bounty was earlier, and basically made HoMM happened. However, they're not the same. HoMM is much more a strategy, with resources, building castles, many heroes by your command... And King's Bounty is the story of one. The mightiest, the bravest... And, again, in case of the Crossworlds and Armored Princess - the prettiest heroine. I would prefer not to spend too much of your time telling of the plethora of gaming mechanics, such as companions, dragon pet, collecting parts of the sea map before sailing further... There are just too many of those "little things". And they are gross when you consider them altogether.

The short conclusion: King's Bounty the Crossworld is one of the best "all-around" games. Casual enough, hardcore enough - just apply the difficulty. A very good adventure through seas, lands, worlds and time. My mark is 8/10, as nothing is perfect, but, just once again - that is one of those games which I would like being installed on my PC while traveling something about as close as Alpha Centauri.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059013593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4098, 'last_played': 1529252561}
review:
I completed KB:C playing in short 1-2 hours sessions once a week or so and it kept me engaged for over a year. I loved that the game let me explore the huge world at my own pace.

A quick tip for first time players - start the Orc Campaign rather than just the vanilla game. It isn't a sequel, it just adds additional content and you may not want to play through the game twice (or maybe you will...)

If you are looking for another turn-based strategy game where you get to collect an army and with permadeath then I would suggest Beastmancer (It scratches the same itch, although it is an indie game and much shorter in length).

author: {'steamid': '76561198067601581', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 9857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9827, 'last_played': 1488760525}
review:
I regret playing Armored Princess first before realizing Crossworlds is the same game with tons of extra features. 
But other than that this is one of the better King's Bounty games currently out there. Nice balance in difficulty, good pace in progression, and a rather medium length game.
A few complaints:
Some of the islands you explore are really small and so a full exploration is pretty short. It felt like there could've been more, such as a few more enemies to fight.
Goblin shamans can use one of their abilities on an opposing unit despite it saying it can only be used on allies. The ability makes it so that between 2 units you selected, the slave unit takes half of the damage the master would've taken(not vice versa, it's a 1 way thing). Because it's most likely you won't be using goblin shaman units in this first place, enemies will take advantage of this and cause you to lose massive amounts of units either way because 1) if you don't attack the master you take a ton of damage from the master itself. 2) if you damage the master unit,  you will take a ton of damage to the slave unit.
Fair huh?

Lastly, adrenaline bugs on orcs. One of the skills you learn is supposed to distribute an amount to your army but sometimes it doesn't and sometimes it only gives it to a unit IF the unit is in the correct army slot. So if you are supposed to get 30 adrenaline at the start of battle, it may only give it to the unit in slot 2, for example, but if that slot 2 is not an orc, no orc in your army will get any adrenaline. Also adrenaline distributed is sometimes not even. Again if 30 is the amount you get, you may get less than that distributed even if your whole army is full of orcs.

So other than the annoying bugs, this is actaully quite a huge improvement over Armored Princess.
I recommend it, not because you also play as a female character but because this is one of the better overall developed King's Bounty PC games out there. Definitely check it out.
9.5/10 Bad bugs, BAD!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103355402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 18167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 405, 'playtime_at_review': 6297, 'last_played': 1710763132}

Das Spiel ist ein rundenbasiertes Strategiespiel, √§hnlich wie Heroes of Might and Magic. Leider gibt es keine Zufallskarten, daf√ºr eine gute Kampagne und neue Szenarien. 

Die strategischen M√∂glichkeiten sind sehr gut ausgearbeitet und durch die verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsgrade ist das Spiel gut erlernbar, aber auch herausfordernd.
