author: {'steamid': '76561197989883060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 21047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2728, 'last_played': 1682377100}
review:
Grandissimo gioco. Ovviamente √® un clone di Heroes of Might and Magic che ho giocato tutti fino al quinto. Gli sviluppatori di Katauri hanno veramente un' ottimo lavoro portando idee nuove ma sopratutto eliminando quelli che sono i difetti principali di Heroes.Vediamo in dettaglio i punti focali 
1) Niente Respawn. Si procede potenziando il personaggio ed il vostro esercito che trover√† via via scontri sempre piu' impegnativi.
2) Lo sviluppo del personaggio e dell'esercito pu√≤ seguire molteplici canali, restituendo al giocatore una grande soddisfazione nell'individuare la strategia giusta.
3) Niente scontri con nemici impossibili che non si capisce come hanno accumulato tanta potenza.
4) Battaglie tatticamente sempre molto interessanti, anche incontrando avversari piu forti ve la potete giocare conoscendo bene le caratteristiche e i poteri delle vostre truppe. Considerate che le battaglie me le sono giocate tutte senza ricorrere alla risoluzione automatica.

Non c'√® lo sviluppo delle citt√† come in heroes le truppe ve le dovete andare a reclutare nei vari posti.
Heroes dal punto di vista grafico resta pi√π sontuoso, ma non basta affatto a farmelo preferire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005257426', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 13988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13176, 'last_played': 1478972665}
review:
I love the King's Bounty series. Crossworlds is like a improved and touched up Armored Princess. It's great, although I do like Dark Side more, it ended up feeling a little hallow/empty at the end, especially after struggling up the enormous timesink and hill that was Hard mode. But still, it's a improvement on the legend, and it's loads of fun. I like it more then Warriors of the North.

The Legend has a special place in my heart, still, but it's really primitive on some parts as much as its simplicity can be awesome and purer. If you're only buying one though, buy Dark Side all the flipping way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054110666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5264, 'last_played': 1566945725}
review: Excellent game. Kings Bounty the Legend has better story imo, but this expansion to Armored Princess just brings so much goodness to the table.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969643946', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1498807239}
review:
Second game in the revamped King's Bounty series. Similar to Heroes of Might and Magic.

-------

This one is an improvement over the first - providing the player with a greater variety of units from the outset which leads to more immediate variety in combat. There are also a few quality of life improvements such as a decent tutorial.

Unfortunately though, the game still has a terrible plot involving hours of reading (or seconds of furious, irritated clicking) and a general sense of "this isn't as fun as I remember it being in Heroes".

At the end of the day, in this case, the oldies are still the best. Try Heroes III or Heroes V instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155712101', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 33734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7049, 'last_played': 1705460116}
review: Having been a long time fan of Heores of Might and Magic 1,2 and 3 this popped up in my steam "you may like" list; and boy was it right! Such a great game I had to buy all of them.  Not only is it visually stunning for its time period but the tactic and strategy are surperb! I wasn't sure at first how I'd like not having to build up a Castle and economy but it totally works for it.  The combat is top notch, I found myself using almost every spell I accquired, which normally doesn't happen in these games. You find the best one and its attack, cast, move and repeat. The tactical combat is a challenge, (I play on Impossible so not sure on other difficulties) and I found myself having to use many of the different units found through out the land. All and all its most certainly worth the money and I will be playing this game many more times. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045531033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1613880932}
review:
King's Bounty is one of those games I always saw but never played. And in the time I've played I can safely say it's easily crawling up the ranks of some of the best strategy games I've played. 

I have a background in strategy games like Civilization, X-COM, Fire Emblem etc and this game definitely scratches that itch with it's own whimsical charms of being a decently done strategy-rpg set in a fairy tale style setting. Like many reviews on here, it's an excellent alternative to Heroes of Might and Magic, and I'm looking forward to playing The Legend since I've been told it's the second best in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149619435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1460937006}
review:
I don't fully understand the hype surrounding the King's Bounty series. 

They're stunning to look at, but the strategy elements are subpar so the combat becomes repetitive.

My problem with the series is that every battle happens within the same exact flat little map with textural changes and random debris taking up a few hexes sometimes. This means that the "strategy" comes down to throwing melee units at other melee units and keeping ranged units safe, and that's it. The terrain never varies and never matters.

There's a vast and interesting unit pool to choose from, but each unit on the battle map actually represents tens to hundreds of individual units of its type so a larger battle is happening underneath the surface that isn't really portrayed. This means the units are really a bunch of nameless cannon fodder while they *appear* to be a ragtag group of combatants (they aren't). 

It's like if every fight in Advance Wars happened on a 10x10 road-covered island, with no bases, no unit production, and the battle animations are turned off.

Or if every fight in FF Tactics happend on a 10x10 flat grassland and every nameless unit just gets texture changes and stat boosts for higher levels without any character customization.

If you look for diverse strategies or advanced unit customization in a tactics game, King's Bounty doesn't have them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075126117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1508722949}
review:
Have you ever dreamed of getting hit on by bartenders, fighting hungover dragons, and slaying vegetarians? Look no further!

The game is mostly King's Bounty : Armored Princess with some extra but I would still get it if you are a fan of Armored Princess (I played armored princess from disk).  Prepare yourself for 100 hours of glorious hexagonal grid combat!  Choose from three main classes and from their customize to your personality in this immersive world filled with creativity, it doesn't need fancy cut scenes and can set your imagination on fire using just text to convey the dialog and story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021970613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4187, 'last_played': 1445766368}
review:
It's a RPG turn-based strategy not unlike Heroes of Might and Magic. Take fun parts of heroes (combat, adventuring, map exploration), remove city managment and bum you got King's Bounty. A single hero expedition to unknown.

Pros:
- tactical and challangen combat
- many different units, items and spells
- bosses
- updated version of Armored Princess
- just one more turn phenomenon
- lot of content (60+ hours)

Cons:
- story (nothing special)
- sometimes repetitive

If you like Heroes of M&M then you will like this.
Best King's Bounty game you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014242486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 4858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4507, 'last_played': 1482690763}
review:
King¬¥s Bount Crossworlds is based on the same (successful) receipt of the Legend, focusing on RPG turn-based strategy.
The game does not include major changes or updates so if you loved/hated the original you will have the same feelings here. It requires careful planning on how to upgrade your hero, equip her with artifacts and spells and form your army. Upgrading the hero is limited by crystal that have to be consumed to level-up the skill tree. Spell allocation and upgrade is done through the use of (limited in number) crystals and formation of army is limited by leadership, economics and availability of specific army types. 
The combination of these elements, and the turn-based character of the battles, add a thick strategic layer that require thinking. If you are rookie you may end up easily without army or resources very early in the game.

Pros:
+ excellent strategic element, turn-based strategy at its best
+ nicely done graphics for environment and units
+ beautiful sound (although one could claim that it is too similar to Legend)
+ huge variety of units, spells and artifacts
+ great repliability as mage, warrior or paladin and by combining different kinds of units
+ nice RPG elements in hero evolution, you end up as a killing machine
+ minor clever changes with respect to Legend that improved on some cons of the original: ability to fly and thus accelerate travel, more maps with shorter surfaces to cover
+ one new class of units (lizards)
+ interesting boss battles that play differently than regular conflicts
+ companion is an interesting addition, similar to the spirits of Legend 
+ very similar to Legend, if you loved it (like me)

Cons:
- very similar to Legend, if you disliked it
- too similar to Legend, especially with respect to the places visited. I would like to see more new places and units
- perhaps there are too many spells, some of them never to be used, you can easily spend too many crystals on them, some hero skills seem irrelevant so are many units
- most of boss battles require specific tanking approach that can be repetitive. Would like to see distinctly different boss battles
- as with Legend if you are new it is very easily to get confused by the game mechanics early in the game. A tutorial could be helpful

All in all, heartily reccomended. As a player who has invested lots and lots of hours in turn-based games  I rank this is one at the very top: one of the shining examples, up there with Heroes of Might and Magic III and King¬¥s Bount Legend. 
On a side note, for the next chapters of the franchise I would like to see more drastic changes (hopefully not leading to a downhill path as HOMM).

author: {'steamid': '76561198004484176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1479924738}
review: Identical to mechanics, graphics, music, characters, system, storyline, and enemies. The only thing different from this is the fact that it introduces an "expansion" to the original game in order to give more storyline. In all honesty, this game is technically an expansion, but it starts and has the exact same beginning, options, characters, and method as the original, where as its 'expansion' only takes place with a separate island and minor side quests. This game could have been easily added as an update and not the exact same. Sadly, like the original, you do not get a choice to select race, only difficulty of game, banner of flag, and style of character (warrior, paladin, mage). This game came in a bundle pack with the others while on sale. I would highly suggest not wasting your time on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022079241', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1575190571}
review:
(Crosswords est l'√©dition int√©grale de "Armored Princess")

Mignon et soign√©, cet opus de King's Bounty est le plus "girly", et offre une excellente alternative √† "Heroes of Might & magic". Il est meilleur que King's Bounty II.

On dirige notre h√©ro√Øne en temps r√©el et combatons au tour-par-tour, au fil d'une aventure assez riche en dialogues.
La s√©rie dispose d'une interface commune et personnalis√©e au niveau des couleurs, selon le jeu.
Chaque King's Bounty a son ambiance, et si jamais quelque chose vous fait tiquer dans celui ci, peut-√™tre aimerez vous "The Dark side" ou "Warriors of the north" par exemple.

En effet, dans chaque volet, le personnage et la palette de couleurs change.
Dans "Crossworlds" on kif Am√©lie, la p'tite nana qui va bien.

Pour le reste, c'est le m√™me jeu : on recrute des troupes et allons √† la baston √† la "Might & Magic".
C'est donc strat√©gique, avec des √©l√©ments de RPG, puisque le h√©ros (ou l'h√©ro√Øne) va prendre du niveau, accumuler de l'√©quipement, et suivre son histoire personnelle.

La patte graphique, la touche sonore, sont de tr√®s bonne facture, la progression agr√©able, avec une libert√© relative mais appr√©ciable. 

Les diff√©rences avec "Might & Magic Heroes" :
- la patte artistique mise sur une approche graphique na√Øve et color√©e, appuy√©e par un ton l√©ger
- le nombre de troupes ennemies ne grandit pas √† chaque tour
- le personnage principal n'avance pas au tour par tour
- On ne dirige pas de villes et ne construit pas de b√¢timents
- Ici l'h√©ro√Øne est aid√©e par un dragonnet mignonnet 

Au registre des reproches, pas grand chose; les textes sont de toute petite taille, assez fatigants √† lire, c'est le seul hic - et ce n'est pas modifiable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011982884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 14064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5903, 'last_played': 1681312945}
review:
Probably my most favourite strategy games of all times and I've played them all. Thanks to King's Bounty I found a new joy of playing videogames again. On the surface it's a HOMAM ripoff of course but beneath it it's got so much more life, vibrancy, sparkle and  new ideas than the ever more listless iterations of HOMAM it has completely overshadowed its old teacher. The Legend, and especially it's perfected sequel Armored Princess, boasts THE best and most enjoyable tactical HOMAM-like combat of all games ever made, no contest.

Unfortunately the publisher decided to milk the series dry and came up with two more sequels, Warriors of the North and Dark Side. Both games have the same exact engine with very few innovations. They're basically glorified custom campaings made in the Map Editor. The sparkle and magic are mostly gone and what we got was lifeless, dull grind, designed without much care or thought, probably by just a fragment of the original team (or maybe just a few interns), just to squeeze a few more dollars from the franchise. Avoid at all costs (Warriors of the North is still passable if you become a KB addict but definitelly avoid Dark Side).

But the first two games are unambiguously great, full of wit and playful brilliance, and will forever remain in my heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991103051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1460094095}
review:
This game has such a unique elements that seems exciting at first but quickly you will realize how much of a grind it is. The troops you can get are not only limited, but youll have to make trips back and forth to where you can buy them. These 2 elements combine to limit expirementation to extreme levels. 

I also have an issue with the battle elements. You have 3 main things to consider/use, your hero spells, your troops, and your dragon. I just dont feel like these 3 systems go well together. There is no cohesiveness. It feels like the troops should be the main focus but your skill tree only empowers one of these things which means you could end up in a situation where your just using your hero spells instead of troops.

The story also takes ages to get going which hampers the expirence even further once youve seen everything the battle system has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010465516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 1845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1470551779}
review: Yes, this game is a lot of fun! The addition of a pet dragon to use Rage points that can support the hero's combat abilities and spellcasting is excellent. It's familiar if you've played King's Bounty: The Legend and you will probably enjoy this game. ****

author: {'steamid': '76561197993234180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3394, 'last_played': 1651625159}
review:
Like all the others in the series, solid great game. I love the variety of creatures you can have in your army. This version has a lot of replayability with the different expansions. 

Like strategy, check
like turn base combat, check
like rpg progression with 3 char classes, check
like dungeon crawling and quests, check
like a minions based combat, check
like no tech issues, fast loading, solid graphics, check

Worth full price. No brainer on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197998142372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2421, 'last_played': 1434587267}
review:
I quit this game for awhile after the first time I played it about 10 hours into the game (level 12) because of my frustration with too much traveling and waiting and not being able to allocate my stats upon leveling up. Unlocking the pegasus ability greatly helped the former, but the latter is still a major downer. Why take the ability to allocate stats [i]out[/i] of the game?

Anyway, this game is much like its predecessor, King's Bounty: The Legend, but it isn't nearly as captivating. I figure one of the main reasons is that you spend a whole lot more time boating around as opposed to walking or flying to other places, which felt far more engrossing. I eventually came back to play it more and had a slightly better experience after getting over a hump in the gameplay. In any case, the game is still fun, and I can recommend it by itself, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it over The Legend. 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022413675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1463354307}
review:
Nueva parte de la saga King¬¥s Bounty, en este caso tan solo se trata del a√±adido de horas extras m√°s a la campa√±a Armored Princess, por lo que si te gusta la saga merecer√° la pena que tengas este t√≠tulo.

Un detalle muy importante es que este tambi√©n incluye el citado Armored Princess, por lo que resulta absurdo comprarse el anterior, yo lo tengo puesto que en la oferta me sal√≠a m√°s barato todo en pack que sacarlo de los tres, pero si est√°s pensando en adquirirlo fuera de oferta, compra el King¬¥s Bounty original y el Crossworld.

Aclarado lo anterior, este t√≠tulo a√±ade cantidad de misiones secundarias relacionadas con los orcos, que conviene jugar junto al AP, todo en un conjunto y as√≠ sacar el m√°ximo partido al juego. Algunas zonas m√°s que explorar y cosas que hacer y poco m√°s, aunque en el men√∫ encontraremos dos interesantes a√±adidos. El primero, un modo en el que somos gladiadores, comenzando con escasez de tropas, debemos combatir contra feroces monstruos en la arena y seguir acumulando dinero para mejorar nuestras tropas y equipo, as√≠ hasta conseguir ser los campeones de la arena.
En el otro modo, debemos defender de los ataques lagartos nuestro castillo, avanzando en escaramuzas hasta expulsarlos del reino, ambos requieren mayor habilidad por parte del jugador puesto que nuestras tropas y recursos son mucho m√°s limitados.

Pero como dije anteriormente, comprad este, sobretodo por la expansi√≥n Armored Princess, el resto es a√±adido t√≠pico que no est√° al nivel de los dos primeros, aunque tambi√©n supondran un buen pu√±ado de horas frente a un King¬¥s Bounty.

NOTA 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026722388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 12569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11274, 'last_played': 1464645599}
review:
[h1]Verdict: 8/10[/h1]

Good fun.

Basically, a bit more of King's Bounty: The Legend. As its predecessor, a classic turn-based mechanic over a rather simplistic story. This time even more than the original, if I remember correctly. Minor role playing possibilities, mostly limited to the character type one chooses. Good number of troop and spell options.

For something with a bit more bite, more RPG elements, better story and more complex interaction between your party, check Expeditions: Conquistator.

For more PrivateJoh‚Äôs personal (re)views you can check [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32042143-PrivateJoh%27s-personal-%28re%29views/] HERE [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198255437292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1474929932}
review:
As a player of King's Bounty:The Legend i was really curious about this game and if it could live up to its predecessor.
I'm not dissapointed to say the least. The art and music are really nice and enjoyable and the battles are the same tactical battles as before. So if you are looking for more after playing the Legend, then this is for you.

For players not known with the King's Bounty series, it happens in a medieval fantasy setting with demons and mages. you yourself play the hero commanding troops and casting spells. because of the huge ammount of different troop choices, there are always new units to try. if i had to summarize in one sentence: it's an adventure and strategy game combined.

If you like strategy games and like to be challenged, then this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993679220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 3839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3777, 'last_played': 1420318651}
review:
A snarky, Heroes of the Might and Magic style RPG quest.  

Yes, I know King's Bounty came first.  

Fun writing, memorable side characters, great combat system, extremely varied unit types, and pretty graphics.  

All these new King's Bounty games are great!

review: I really enjoy this version of it. it has 4 campaigns to pick from including armored princess. its worth playing it if you enjoyed kings bounty or you enjoy strategy type games. i have barely even touched the game and it has a pretty decent amount of content for it to satisfy me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049527900', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 7462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7307, 'last_played': 1438709479}
review:
Pretty much the same stuff as in Legend but more of it so if you liked that then you will almost assuredly like this as well. Also the main campaign continues from the 1st game so if you haven't played that yet then you might want to.

A few changes worth mentioning: 
1. You now have achievements that when completed give stat bonuses. This might annoy some people since a lot of them demand you play a certain way to unlock them. Ex: using fireball X number of times, not losing any troops in X number of battles and so on.
2. In this one one get a baby dragon as your rage ''tool'' and since he doesn't get any dialog players expecting a interesting side character like the rage spirits might get a bit let down.
3. Better map navigation then the 1st. Having a ship going to separate islands makes the trips back home for reinforcements soooooo much faster.
4. Difficulty is higher than Legend so this might be a + or - depending on the player. Personally while it took a little while to get used to it I found the added difficulty welcome ( most of the time ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198017165422', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1417263573}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112705333', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1445600132}
review:
This is an excellent version of King's Bounty, I had a good time.

This game runs flawlessly on my system on high settings and I've heard it runs very well for most people.

I completed the Orcs on the March, the Champion Of The Arena, and the Defender Of The Crown Campaigns on Normal difficulties.

This version features some extra campaigns you can do which are basically a boss rush and a condensed version of the game. Orcs on the March is the expansion to Armoured Princess, so you might as well play that version of the two.

This series has a love it or hate it style of gameplay. The changes this game series has from version to version is very minor.
It's a hex-grid turn based RPG, and when your not in battle, you will be clicking the landscape to explore the land, pick up items, searching for gold, talking to people for quests.

The game can feel slow paced at times and the music is very classical so it's actually possible to doze off playing this game.

If you enjoy the series or want to get into it, this is a fine game to spend time on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039987043', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 12205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7537, 'last_played': 1610582628}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064954707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1567620460}
review:
This is a casual RPG. It is a great time-waster, assuming you do not require depth and sophistication, and prefer a casual treadmill over a more intense, rollercoaster experience.

As others have pointed out, this plays like Heroes of Might & Magic, stripped of all superfluous base management and strategy elements.

For those wondering, this is the best place in the series to begin. It has all the new bells and whistles, cutscenes, new unlockable passive abilities, large scale maps, and now leveleable troops.

The combat is also more dynamic, containing obstacles and large bosses.

This is purely the definition of a "fun," novelty game.

And it is not a flop like Dark Side, either. Overall, 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187330631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3311, 'last_played': 1432819695}
review:
I only play this game for the game mechanics, not for the sexy art, I swear!!!
Seriously, though.... The art is great, but the game is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 3590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3590, 'last_played': 1435056868}
review: When I've purchased this game I thought that it was just another standalone title of the franchise but I've got really surprised to know that it was basically a polished version of 'Armored Princess'. Yes, there's actually a raw copy of 'Armored Princess', plus another one that includes an expansion pack about orcs, which brings some new quests, items etc. Besides that, there're also two other mini campaign modes available. In one of them, you're this random guy who find himself in an arena and have to fulfill certain missions in order to be able to gain influence and recruit stronger creatures to fight against the bosses. The other one I'd say that is like a 'training drill' for Amelie, where you have to go through a few difficult battles in order to prove your value or something. Anyway, both of these can be finished quite easily. Overall, if you haven't bought 'Armored Princess' yet, I'd strongly advise you to just skip it, because this title is unarguably superior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130415895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1472515404}
review:
This game is just too pretty for words, and it runs very well on my almost 5 year old laptop on mostly high settings. Heck, even on all low settings the game is still beautiful.

Now to the gameplay: The combat plays very much like the HoMM series, yet is still quite unique and diverse. I'm someone who finds it rather difficult getting into HoMM-like games because I love that series so much, but this game... is so unique and fun that I can't help but love everything about it. I love the free-roaming, the easy to use interface, the sea faring and quirky humour. I love the different units and all their special abilities, I lovelovelove my dragon which is so useful! Even the music is breathtakingly beautiful and sets the mood so well.

This game is definitely worth the price. I grabbed it on a sale hoping to god it would run okay-ish on my laptop. It does and is worth every cent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041216334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1443577004}
review:
Have only played 97 mins of this game and I'm already sold on it.  Best 3 bucks I have spent in a long while.  I gladly would of paid full price for it, but luckliy I picked this gem up on sale which is even better. 

Buy this if you love turn based fantasy RPG games.  You will not regret it.  9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960787409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1491002238}
review: I got this game in a bundle with 4 others for $6 on sale.  I have put over 26 hours into the game so far, and while I have gotten somewhat tired of the game, I have thoroughly enjoyed it.  What I can't emphasize enough is the value that comes with this game.  26+ hours in, and I still haven't beat the first of the four campaigns; I am probably 75% through the campaign I am in right now.  There is easily 100+ hours of content in this game, way more than you get out of most AAA titles, and at around 10-15% of the price (on sale).   The graphics remind me of an updated version of Warcraft 3 (which I love), and I really enjoyed the combat.  If you are a fan of these types of games, there is no reason why you shouldn't pick up Kings Bounty: Crossworlds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018409980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1434178101}
review: Ce jeu est bas√© dans le monde des Might & magic. Il a des r√®gles originales mais elles ne m'ont pas plu. C'est surtout la limitation de cr√©atures commandables bas√©e sur des points de commandement et l'absence de production de ces cr√©atures qui sont en stock limit√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002719748', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1433821009}
review:
This continues a fantastic series which predated the original Heroes of Might and Magic. This title, released about 20 years after the original, is both quite faithful and a fantastically fun game. The artefact system is like the HoMMIII and the skills like Diablo II. That enough makes it a challenge between where to boost your army and what skills to enhance your and their abilities. Having played both Armored Princess and this, I'd give my recommendation to this game. It has certain quests that I thouroghly enjoyed and many new and powerful units. This game did crash more than Armored Princess. That's a total of 1. I set sail for a new island and crashed hard.

I will say that the other games attached to this are kind of crap. The arena is basically all the boss fights. The lizardmen campain is nearly worthless. They are thankfully short and, I suppose, good for a quick dose of the gameplay without getting sucked in to the main storyline.

The graphics are old, but haven't started showing their age just yet. The sound is slightly repetitive. Some of the quests are best skipped.

Overall, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973236751', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1433626453}
review:
King's Bounty Crosswords is an overlooked rpg/strategy hybrid wich stayed under my radar when it was published in 2010. 
Crossworlds contains also the "The armored Princess" campaign. If you want to play "The Armored Princess" buy this game!

I would suggest to start with the "Orcs on the March" campaign - the director's cut of "The Armored Princess".

author: {'steamid': '76561197967668280', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1616383037}
review:
FIRST: Everyone is correct, purchase 'King's Bounty: Crossworlds" as it includes the base game and both expansions for $5 more than the standard edition but $5 less than the platinum edition.

SECOND: Actually really enjoy this game so far, especially considering I'm just now diving into strategy games. The mechanics take a little bit to figure out but after about an hour you should have a pretty firm grasp of what does what. The graphics are pretty darn good if a little cartoony but that doesn't bother me any. I really like the mix of strategy/fantasy rpg. It's actually a lot of fun, sorta like playing fantasy chess if you will. There doesn't seem to be much of any voice acting, again not a problem for me but just be prepared to do a lot of reading to get the back story and follow what is going on.

Would definitely recommend a buy if you like these kind of games. I'm terrible at and have always hated strategy games but this one is pretty darn fun. Also my first time reviewing a game on steam so, that should tell you something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038538764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 23874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22782, 'last_played': 1431842330}
review:
Umfangreich und f√ºr jeden empfehlenswert, der Spiele wie Heroes of Might and Magic mag!

Heroes selbst ging damals aus der Kings Bounty Serie hervor. Beide spielen sich deshalb √§hnlich, aber nicht gleich. Dies ist eigentlich das Zusatzpack zum 2. Teil der Serie ("Armored Princess"). Da "Crossworlds" (eigentlich Zusatzpack) aber den kompletten 2. Teil  umfasst, sowie neue Einheiten und Spr√ºche sollte man diesen Teil kaufen und nicht "Armored Princess". Dieser Teil ist auch komplett bugfrei und jede Erkl√§rung und Beschreibung passt, enth√§lt inzwischen also keinerlei Fehler.

Es spielt sich im Prinzip wie der 1, Teil der Serie. Allerdings ist es noch umfangreicher, hat viele neue Einheiten und Zauberspr√ºche. Theoretisch ist es auch nicht so linear wie der 1. Teil, da man zwischen verschiedenen Inseln und ihren V√∂lkern hin und her springen kann. Zum Freischalten der Inseln muss man jeweils etwas schwerere K√§mpfe bestehen.

Die Wutgeister aus dem 1. Teil gibt es jetzt als normale Zauberspr√ºche. Daf√ºr hat man jetzt einen kleinen Drachen dabei, der andere, aber durchaus n√ºtzliche Fertigkeiten mitbringt. Auch ist das Spiel sehr auf Zufall ausgelegt. Dies wirkt sich auf die kaufbaren Einheiten und Gegenst√§nde/Zauber zum Sammeln aus. Leider ist das nicht immer positiv. In einem Durchgang verfollst√§ndigt man ein Gegenstandsset/findet alle wichtigen Zauberspr√ºche, im anderen nicht. In einem Durchgang findet man vielleicht gen√ºgend Monster f√ºr seinen Spilstil, im anderen nicht. Eigentlich sollte dies zum mehrmaligen Durchspielen motivieren, ich sehe aber hierin einen grundlegenden Fehler des Spiels. Wenn man n√§mlich in der Hauptstory voran schreitet, bekommt man immer mehr Menscheneinheiten zum kaufen. Andere V√∂lker jedoch nicht. Will ich aber mit Orks spielen, bin ich nur auf die vorhandenen angewiesen. Hier sollten eigentlich auch mit Fortschritt in der Hauptstory mehr Einheiten anderer V√∂lker freigeschaltet werden...

Als neue V√∂lker gegen√ºber dem 1. Teil gibt es nun ein Reptilienvolk, welches rundum gelungen ist und interessante neue und abwechslungsreiche Kreaturen bietet. Diese machen sowohl als Gegner, als auch als eigene Einheiten viel Spass. Zudem gibt es das neue Volk der Orks mit ihrer Adrenalin F√§higkeit. Die besagt, das mit mehr T√∂tungen durch die Orks deren Adrenalin anw√§chst und so auch deren Spezialf√§higkeiten erm√∂glicht. Allerdings nerven Orks als Gegner nur und sind meiner Meinung nach over-powered. Wenn ich eine Gruppe habe, die alle Gegner umhaut habe ich bei den Orks fast immer unvermeidbare Verluste. Nicht sch√∂n...

Negativ anzumerken ist auch, dass der Anfang auf den ersten 3 Inseln zu z√§h ist. Man bekommt zuwenig "Kanonenfutter", um seinen Held zu leveln. Deswegen sind alle K√§mpfe am Anfang nen Tacken zu schwer. Ausserdem sind 2 Gegner Im Spiel v√∂llig zu schwer geraten-bei denen passt das Balancing hinten und vorne nicht. Im Anschluss an mein Review hab ich mit einigem Abstand (wegen Spoiler Gefahr) deren Namen mit einigen Tips zum Besiegen mal aufgeschrieben.

Richtig vermisst habe ich auch den Humor des 1. Teils. Wo man da oft ins Schmunzeln kam und der Held alles mit einem Augenzwinkern sah, ist die Heldin hier langweilig.

Jedoch √ºberwiegen insgesamt gesehen die positiven Aspekte weit die negativen. Liebhaber von Heroes und dem 1. Teil der Serie sollten definitiv zuschlagen! Klare Kaufempfehlung!

















P.S.: Die v√∂llig zu schwer geratenen Gegner sind zum einen 
- der K√∂nig der Echsen (Khatu). Hier sollte man mit Paladinen oder Dunklen Rittern antreten. Diese k√∂nnen ihn fast allein fertig machen. Andere Einheiten haben aber massive Probleme bei ihm. Seine Angriffe (auch der Fl√§chenschaden) sind k√∂rperliche Angriffe, wogegen Paladine und Dunkle Ritter gut gewappnet sind.
- Der zweite schlecht balancierte Gegner ist Scrounger. Eine Orkheldin, aus dem Zusatzpack mit massigst Orks. Da dieses Volk eh zu stark geraten ist, ist dieser Kampf viel zu schwer. Hier hilft fast nur der Zauberspruch "Magische Fesseln" auf Stufe 3, der alle Spezialf√§higkeiten des Gegners blockiert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007300752', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 5357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5357, 'last_played': 1427345124}
review:
The Kings Bounty series is interesting. It's cute but a failure to innovate the series leaves new players a choice of 4 or 5 ames that are essentially the same. Crossworlds is probably the best of the King's Bounty series. The game is bright, colorful and interesting to explore. Having an interesting game world goes a long way in keeping your interest.

The gameplay is rather simple. Buy your troops (these increase over time) and go fight battles. Again and again and again. It's tough to figure out why I like this game so much because it is so repetitive. But every battle is different, every combination of troops a potential interesting tactical puzzle to solve and there's always something - a quest, an area or just a distant castle - to keep you moving foward. There's always a challenge out there and there's always a new, interesting place to visit and cool, different types of troops to use. There's always a new spell to use or upgrade, and new item to equp or a new skill to choose. The rewards are well paced and keep the player interested in the game.

Now I believe sometimes a game can take too long and this is one. It would have been a better game at 20 hours. After wa while you may very well get bored with the formula. In fact, it could be said that the game may be best played on easy just so you can move through the content as quickly as possible. But it's one of those titles that you can dive back into and pick up at any time. 

The formula works well enough despite the repitive nature of the game. It's cute, it's fun and it's worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048130638', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3830, 'last_played': 1512143926}

review:
Very well made and fun. Similar to Heroes of Might and Magic. Definetly worth the price.

I would recommend playing this instead of 'Kings Bounty the legend' since this one has simingly minor improvements that really help you out throughout the long campaign.

The boss battles are a bit tough though, even on easy difficulty, since it doesn't allow you to use your pet dragon, which I find kind of an odd design choice since boss battles are really where you need extra help...

author: {'steamid': '76561198083849058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1931, 'last_played': 1507653756}
review:
Ich habe dieses Strategie-Spiel nun √ºber 33 Stunden gespielt, bin Level 34 und hab noch nicht mal die H√§lfte an Inseln abgearbeitet. Das Spiel fesselt sehr und es f√§llt mir immer extrem schwer, irgendwo Schlu√ü zu machen. Es werden mit den zu l√∂senden Haupt- und Nebenquests interessante Geschichten erz√§hlt. Das Spielprinzip macht sehr s√ºchtig. Das Spiel sieht sch√∂n aus, die Grafik ist toll und Detailreich. Die Animationen im Kampf sind witzig gemacht und abwechslungsreich. Der Sound passend dazu.  

Mit Prinzessin Amelie hat man eine weibliche Heldin, die man mit Hilfe von drei Skillstrees weiter entwickeln kann. Schl√ºssel zum Erfolg ist nicht nur die F√§higkeit, die Truppen auch f√ºhren zu k√∂nnen (sonst machen sie sich im Kampf selbstst√§ndig). Entwickelt man die F√§higkeit (was lange dauert), kann man auch durch Intelligenz die Truppen vom Gegner √ºberreden, √ºberzulaufen. F√ºr Magier empfiehlt sich die volle Durchskillung des Magie/Mana-Baumes. Aber auch Intelligenz ist wichtig. Mana und Wut sind im Kampf wichtig, ohne Wut kann man den Drachen nicht benutzen, ohne Mana kann man nicht zaubern. Darum sollte man m√∂glichst schnell so skillen, dass diese Werte erh√∂ht werden. 

Man bekommt einen kleinen Drachen (Farbe und Anfangsf√§higkeiten kann man sich aussuchen), der im Kampf hilft und ein Zauberbuch, dass man schnell mit neuen Spr√ºchen f√ºllen sollte, die man √ºberall in der Welt finden kann. Schriftrollen kann man ins Buch √ºbertragen, damit man den Spruch dauerhaft beh√§lt. Und das sollte man so fr√ºh wie m√∂glich nutzen. 

Truppen holt man sich in der Welt in den verschiedenen Geb√§uden. Es lohnt sich jeder Besuch und auch, die F√§higkeiten und Werte der Truppen zu vergleichen. Es z√§hlt nicht nur die St√§rke, die Anzahl oder dass sie viel Schaden machen, sondern auch, wie gro√ü ihre Widerstandskraft ist und ob sie Spezialf√§higkeiten im Kampf einsetzen k√∂nnen. So holen manche noch andere Truppen durch Beschw√∂rung, rufen oder keimen dazu, k√∂nnen Zauber aussprechen oder sich verwandeln (Werw√∂lfe, Vampire). Eine gute Mischung aus starken Fernk√§mpfern, Magiern und starken Nahk√§mpfern ist wichtig. Sammelt man flei√üig die Eier aus herumliegenden Nestern, kann man diese Kreaturen dann im Kampf einsetzen oder ausbr√ºten und in die eigene Armee integrieren. Aber vorsicht, man hat nur wenige Pl√§tze und zwei Reservepl√§tze zur Verf√ºgung. Hier sollte man besonders gute Truppen im Vorrat kaufen, zum Beispiel Drachen, Riesen, Paladine oder Zyklopen, denn es dauert lange, bis man die F√ºhrungsf√§higkeit f√ºr eine stattliche Menge dieser guten K√§mpfer zusammen hat. Und so kann man nach jedem Kampf und bei jedem Levelaufstieg ein paar aus der Reserve nehmen.

Ist eines der Geb√§ude wichtig f√ºr einen Quest, wird ein kleines F√§hnchen dar√ºber angezeigt. Dann muss man nur noch die richtige Dialogzeile ausw√§hlen. Das habe ich leider erst etwas sp√§ter gemerkt. Will man Schl√∂sser angreifen, kann man mit einem Rechtsklick die St√§rke und Zusammensetzung der Truppen sehen und sich √ºberlegen, ob es zu schaffen ist. Dort kann man dann oft besonders tolle Truppen kaufen und auch wertvolle Artefakte und Ausr√ºstung. 

Die Artefakte und Ausr√ºstungen sind noch eine Methode, wie man seine Heldin weiter entwickeln kann. Beispielsweise gibt es dreier-Sets, die einen starken Bonus geben, wenn man alle drei Teile ausger√ºstet hat (Zum Beispiel Wut oder Vorteile beim f√ºhren eines bestimmten Volkes). Es gibt aber auch Artefakte, die man aufwerten kann, in dem man hinein geht, um mit den W√§chtern zu k√§mfen. Diese K√§mpfe sind schwerer, als normale K√§mpfe. Zudem haben manche Gegenst√§nde eine schlechte oder gute Moral, da sollte man also aufpassen. Auch wenn Truppen zusammen k√§mpfen, die nicht zusammen passen, kann sich das schlecht auf die Moral auswirken, also beispielweise wenn Paladine mit dunklen Rittern k√§mpfen m√ºssen. Um Platz f√ºr all diese Gegenst√§nde zu haben, kann man sich unterwegs einen Begleiter aufsammeln, der dann auch ausger√ºstet werden kann. Ich habe bisher drei m√∂gliche Begleiter gefunden: einen Piraten, einen Elfen und einen dunklen Ritter.

Zudem gibt es noch mehrere Bosse wie einen Riesenfrosch, einen Bohrer, eine Riesenspinne und dergleichen, die ich bisher noch nicht besiegen konnte, da sie sich immer in Phasen Helfer auf das Schlachtfeld holen und kurz bevor sie sterben regenerieren. 

Rundenbasiert sind nur die K√§mpfe. Ansonsten l√§uft man in der Welt in Echtzeit herum. Bzw. man ist auch mit dem Schiff unterwegs und kann im Wasser ebenso Sch√§tze aufsammeln und K√§mpfe bestreiten (gegen Piraten). Zu manchen Gegenden muss man sich den Weg erst suchen. 

Alles in allem: ein tolles Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170957458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1427651958}
review:
I am having fun with this game!  Haven't played all the campaigns yet, focusing on beating the original one first.  This game does require some strategy and it's good to save often.  Each island is a bit of a challenge, but eventually enemies stop being marked as "lethal" or "invincible" and then it's just a matter of (saving first) jumping in to the fight.

Getting around is easy, graphics are good enough (imho), don't care about the story at all though I do find the Princess's dialogue to be trite and badly written.  Overall, enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965743021', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1786, 'last_played': 1423071154}
review:
An excellent turn-based strategy. It's better and more clever than Heroes of Might and Magic. It's all combat though; no empire management type stuff. My only gripe is the limited number of a unit type available to buy. It makes it hard to recover from too many pyrrhic victories; you can't just go grind gold to buy more.

+ Everything
+ Enough random generation for several playthroughs
- No way to grind if it gets too hard (rare). You're just stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051751157', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2465, 'last_played': 1505934750}
review:
This game is a good kind of differnt when it comes to RPGS I have played in the past.  While you do have a main hero, they are more of a commander and overlook the battles that your hired mercenaries take part in.  If you buy this it comes with Kings Bounty: Armored Princess so you will not need to buy that one at all. Also the Orcs campaign is the Armored princess game with extra updates so there is no reason unless you are a die hard fan to ever play the original.

Pros

+Interesting turn based RPG with many different elements effecting battle
+4 different difficulties 
+Takes a while to learn but a long time to master
+The items are very interesting and have qwirks about them such as a morale rating or life which will make you change your items or fight to keep them working
+Vast land to run around
+Pet Dragon helps in battle and levels up with you
+Can choose from 9 baby dragons at the start which will change your starting tactics a lot
+Large variety of Mercenaries to choose from which all have items that boost their stats
+Large skill tree
+You can also take on a helper who assists with different things and can also hold extra items
+Mercenary attributes and abilities differ greatly between races/classes
+Bosses are fun and different/There are other Hero Battles that change your tactics a bit
+Replayability is pretty high considering you have 3 differnt classes and tons of items and mercs to choose from
+Sets for items as well as "Artefacts" which have bonus effects when worn together
+All the islands vary greatly in how they look and the feal about them
+Game comes with the original version and two other modes as well

Cons

-Money is only gained through combat or on the ground in small doses and if you lose to many units and can't battle you may get into a tight situation
-Lots of running around trying to find a max number of mercenaries for your pack
-Story line isn't very important
-Troops on certain islands can really range in difficulty making it hard to move about
-Mercenaries have limits and can run out eventually
-Training new mercs costs a ton of trophies which are gained from combat and you can easily run out
-Mercenaries are at different locations and are sometimes extremely hard to find 
-You don't earn a better way of travel until about half way through the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197984737819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1664959041}
review: Oh all off the KB games I have played...dating back to the Sega Genesis version. This one is my favorite, the pet dragon rocks. Its very streamlined, love the orc thing.... If your think about any of these titles, I would pick up this one. ESPECIALLY if goes on sale again, youll get countless hours of strategic goodness...9 out of 10 !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975409788', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 4680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3362, 'last_played': 1688531860}
review: Play as an underage anime girl as she quests to find the creepy 50 year old man that loves her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003509214', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1416590313}
review:
For an Armored Princess her suit seems to stop quite suddenly at the waist...but i digress.

Not sure why you cant call your pet dragon for boss fights but otherwise a fairly straight forward fantasy strat game. 

Enemy difficulty seems to vary wildly depending on the class you pick, thankfully you can slip past most to grab key loot (like maps)

If you like the battles in Age of Wonders this is worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021756703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5043, 'last_played': 1412820999}
review: Perhaps the most distinctive of all King's Bounty games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140869674', 'num_games_owned': 1551, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 21156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5633, 'last_played': 1574892810}
review:
Not best Turn-Based strategy game and not best RPG game. It‚Äôs the definitive one of the best mixs of Turn-Based Hex grid battles with RPG elements.

Gameplay:
+ Semi-randomized world. - It's almost impossible that you meet all the spells, units and items in first try.
+ Replay value.
+ Seven different races. - Humans, Elves, Orcs, Undeads, Demons, Dwarves and the Lizardmen.
+ Literally tons of units. - Over 100 different units.
+ Over 60 different Spells. - Divided into three sections: Order, Distortion, and the Chaos.
+ A vast world to explore. - Include 14 different islands. 
+ Wide-range of quests.
+ Decent AI.
+/- Three playable classes. - the Warrior, the Paladin and the Mage. Each class has one specific skill and other skills selectable by other classes.

The atmosphere and graphics: 
+ Stunning fantasy world. 
+ Impressive textures quality.
+ Quite nice landscapes.
+ Beautiful 3D graphics.
+ Detailed Units, Objects, Levels and the Spells.
+ Good music and sound.

Performance:
+ Running pretty well and smooth on a mid-range PC.
+ Fast combat loading.
- Delay at launch time.

Additional:
+ Steam cloud.
+ Level editor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069685070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4181, 'last_played': 1587804086}
review: Fairly long for the price point, it's like Heroes of Might and Magic without any of the multiplayer features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030786790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 14304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4785, 'last_played': 1669388760}
review:
Similar to Heroes of Might and Magic, King's Bounty will keep you coming back if you are strategy fan. It does away with city building, and focuses on combat, hero building, and troop selection. Add a pet dragon that can turn the tide of battle, numerous artifacts you can find or buy, a varied pool of troops to select from, and a well thought out hero skill tree, King's Bounty Crossworlds is fantastic.

Highly recommended if you like fantasy strategy games that are challenging, and doubly recommended if you loved Heroes of Might and Magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966166767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1416350341}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025072461', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 4041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4041, 'last_played': 1414802517}
review: 60ish hours worth of island exploration, all the while you expand your army with more and better troops and upgrade your hero through gear and talents. Enjoyable turn-based combat. The game is randomly seeded which adds replay value. Some great additions over the base game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026667042', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 9911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7902, 'last_played': 1443669291}
review: King's Bounty Crossworlds IS Armored Princess, with more content, features, and orcs. If you're buying, just get the Crossworlds edition for turnbased, light hearted, epic questing.

review: Great game which while being similar in some aspects to Might & Magic Heroes, it is overall quite different, I really like the variety of spells the game has.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961295487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4389, 'last_played': 1677944314}
review:
First of all: Crossworlds = enhanced Armored Princess for PC gamers. The stand-alone Armored Princess is intended for Mac users, since there's no Crossworlds for Mac. 

Secondly: this is probably the best King's Bounty there is. It has all the good stuff - pleasurable grind, silly-but-fun storyline, plenty of different units and spells etc. without the negatives of the later games (i.e. game-breaking bugs, excessive back-and-forth-running, so-so balance). 

+ nice atmosphere
+ constant feeling of progress
+ plenty to do (50+ hours per playthrough easily)
+ holds its grip until the very end

+/- lots and lots of text, but it's skimmable and light-heartedly funny

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998718279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 35506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11943, 'last_played': 1704419839}
review:
Wonderful itteration of classic mold TBSRPG, turn based stratagy role playing game.  The franchise predesessor of heroes of might and magic, has renewed itself again as a mix of real time world movement, and turn based grid combat. 

This series is a real gem for new and old alike, from those who are familiar with HOMM series to those who have never heard of it.  A word of caution though, it will get a bit tedious towards---or on the way to---the end of the game when you run into one of two problems.

1. everything is too easy and you have the 'perfect' army and tactical setup.
2. everything is too hard and you lose every fight, and now have no money.

However, the game provides an easy 40 hours of fun, for the price is a worthwhile investment, with high replayability, I'd imagine the developement of the game needs to tinker a bit with it to make it more balanced.  Have tested the game numerous times on all difficulties mainly with the Mage class.  there are 3 classes to play, each class sports a different playstyle and has a mind  boggling amount of customization from army composition, skills, and items, everything is also randomly generated to a point, that is to say within certani perameters.  

I'd recomend purchasing if you enjoy a good spot of fantasy and strategy battles, especially if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023609330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3895, 'last_played': 1371814002}
review:
So... 68 hours behind and I can say that it wasn't so cool such I had expected. I do believe that King's Bounty: The Legend is a truly masterpiece, but this game... looks like a big fan-project. I tried to finish all quests in the game to complete my final opinion. Yeah, it was so long and boring, I did it just because of my passiiom to The Legend... 
King's Bounty: The Legend is the best King's Bounty ever. The remaining part of this franchise is not so good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125904040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1408783705}
review:
This game has a lot packed into one game... It has RPG elements, turn-based strategy-style combat, grinding gameplay, well-written story, etc etc.

If any of those things interest you then you should give the game a shot. Pick up "Crossworlds" because you'll end up receiving several games in one package with it.

8/10 buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002921804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1404051237}
review:
Fairly Early on review. Posting simply in case somebody with the game on their wishlist sees it, before the summer sale ends. 

Odd concepts that so far do not equal a truly great game. Non Re-spawning enemies is a odd choice, when adding in the permadeath of your troops, being able to grind the new ones up to a suitable level feels like a needed feature. King's Bounty instead teaches you to take better care of them, and will have you re-loading after a hard fought battle, simply because you did not win it with acceptable losses. 

The story is interesting, but presented in text conversations that tend to go on and on....if you are like me, and reading is not something you tend to do in games, you may find yourself simply skipping everything and just following your quest marker. I am honestly not sure what is going on in my game, but the opening video and story seemed like a nice concept. Dimensional travel, in search of possible time travel....or maybe I didn't pay enough attention and have that wrong. 

Lots of different troops, each playing slightly different in battle. Fights are turn based, and take place on a hex board. Some boards will have obstacles in your path, and you and your enemy will also have the ability to spawn more if need be. Your hero does not actually fight however, but simply gives orders and casts magic. While that was certainly disappointing, it does not detract to much from it. Fights are tense, but do tend to take awhile once the enemy starts piling up large amounts of troops. 

The fights are made easier by the inclusion of a dragon you are given at the start of the game. You can summon it every other turn to do multiple things. Great damage, build walls, pick up treasure, give more magic, and more. Have a hard foe, or a enemy taking pot shots at you from long range? Just let the dragon kill them, no real strategy needed. While he does feel cheap, I did enjoy using him. 

This reminds me of a board game. You move your pieces around, and try to out think or out maneuver your opponent. I am only on the 3rd Island, but so far the AI does not seem to be the greatest. They tend to consider how each troop acts, but not how to use them with the other units in their army. Terrain also seems to confuse them, though it may only be due to how early in the game I am. Most of the challenge thus far has come from the large numbers or troops, instead of their tactics. They tend to just rush me with melee, and have the mages or archers stay back. 

Game looks very dated, almost reminds me of World of Warcraft when it first launched. It still looks decent though, and it is very vibrant and colorful. No real issues on that end, and I like the cartoonish look of everything. 

The game so far has been enjoyable, and there are cheat codes you could resort to if the permadeath becomes a issue. So I would say don't let that and not being able to grind keep you from trying it out. The price is decent, and I have easily gotten my moneys worth with as little as I have played so far. I would say the biggest enjoyment is trying out all the different troops and seeing what each one can do. Then trying to build a hero around supporting them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120878629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1527022437}
review: Great sequel to kings bounty legions, it still has the iconic 3D, grid, turn based pvp that made the game so much different from other games. Nice to be able to have a more structured campaign than just going around the world kiling monsters for the hell of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023120336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29627, 'last_played': 1387062572}
review: Love King's Bounty!  I've played hundreds of hours in most of the series and each game is great.  Support the devs, buy and play a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985027348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1403466627}
review:
I am very surprised by how fun this game is.  I've had this game in my library for quite a while, and finally found some time to give it a go, and what I found is a very deap, challenging, and almost limitless game.  At the time of my writing this I believe I have about 10 hours of play time.

Pros:
-I love getting destroyed when I go to locations I should be
-Lots of varied mission objectives
-Feels like a ton of customization features when it comes to your troops and your skills

Cons:
-Biggest complaint is just the amount of text, be prepared to do a lot of reading if you want to follow the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011604006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 13637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13637, 'last_played': 1315033200}
review: Absolutely awesome game. The Kings Bounty series remains one of my favorites of all time, and one of the only series I'll actually replay through several times. It's an exploration game where you lead armies around the world, picking up relics and leveling up your character. It plays similarly to games like Heroes of Might and Magic, but the major difference (and the reason I like this series better), is you are encouraged and rewarded for exploring. There is no turn counter while you explore the map, putting you in a race against other towns or enemies. Explore as much as you want and roam everywhere without fear that your enemy is building up their army while you have fun. If you run into an area where the enemy is too strong for you, just explore somewhere else and come back once you gain some levels and spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043811791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1388779440}
review: Nice turn-based strategy with some cool quests. The storyline is simple, yet entertaining, but the real gem is the combat system with a nice variety of creatures and a nice role-playing system. Highly recommend for all fans of Heroes of Might and Magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057372331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1400974190}
review: I was looking forward to this game since I enjoy most turn-based combat games. I have never been so disappointed in a game. It's nearly impossible to advance past a certain point without repeatedly dying. There are no opportunities for grinidng, so if you come up against an enemy you can't handle and you've already killed all the easy ones: you're screwed. The combat is repetitive and unrewarding. Having to dispatch groups of 100+ minions is boring to the point of tears. Spend your money elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037910259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1429467759}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030795982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1887, 'last_played': 1624020903}
review: Repetitive, silly, grindy.  Love it.  Where else can you mix and match knights, archers, plants, wolves, spiders, dragons, snakes, undead, orcs, and robots?  The difficult part is that you can never clear a new area when you first arrive; there is always a stack or ten that completely outclass you;  once you have gone to a new area, gotten more and better troops and spells, you come back and kick those "invincible" dudes easily.  Huge world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028548485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1809, 'last_played': 1434670755}
review:
(Mostly posting this for badge progress)
I don't recommend this game because it simply lacks balance. When, even on the easiest difficulty, the recommended strategy is "run around collecting things and avoiding enemies until the random pickups make you strong enough to survive," there's a huge problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047229906', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2156, 'last_played': 1429048081}
review: Just as solid as the other Kings Bounty games but with a new race (the Orcs) that keeps it fresh, they're tricky enough to keep you on your toes but not different enough to change the game in any dramatic way. Essentially more of the same, and that is not a bad thing at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969960651', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9322, 'last_played': 1396050153}
review:
King‚Äôs Bounty: Crossworlds is a fantastic game which features aspects of RPG & Turn-Based Strategy. It offers you the main campaign (Orcs on the March: Expansion for Armored Princess with additional content) and 2 other smaller campaigns (Champion of the Arena: Boss Battles in Gladiatorial Combat & Defender of the Crown: Battles in Unique Arenas). It is suppose to be similar to the HOMM & Fallen Enchantress, but it feels more enjoyable with the main campaign lasting between 40-60 hours. You get to choose between 3 starting classes (Warrior, Paladin, Mage), each with a special ability (skill) and with crossoworlds, you receive an additional skill, which varies depending on your class. You also get a pet dragon, which can "cast" special dragon abilities, which are really cool!! Overall the game is worth playing and I would recommend it!!

Pros: 
Beautiful Music
Spells & Pet Dragon
Randomized "Worlds" (No 2 playthroughs are the same)
Good Story
Lots of different types of units to use, ranging from humans, to undead to dragons‚Ä¶

Cons: 
Learning curve is a bit high (but once you figure out the game, it is really easy)
The first 4 islands can be hard for a new player

author: {'steamid': '76561198032238571', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 6481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6431, 'last_played': 1395625387}
review:
As a serious strategy gamer - I really enjoy this game, alot. But there's a serious flaw: it's too easy unless it's on the hardest mode, but then it becomes unwinnable unless you use -one- tactic as a specific point in the game. So, once you get to snowy island with the machines and nords, get engineers, robots, and split your healer-bots into two groups. Make them heal each other. 

Now you've gotten through the unbalanced part of the game. Stop using that strategy if you want it to be at all challenging/fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006004577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1661293138}
review: Like Heroes of Might and Magic? Want to just control a hero and not worry about that pesky city building, or enemies taking them from you? Want to go on an epic adventure with an army and combat like in the HoMM games? This game is what you should buy, then! It's the HoMM experience without city building, but more features in other areas, where you go around hiring allies for your army, to engage in combat in that exciting HoMM way!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063338061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1391083102}
review: best game in the series of King's Bounty; buy this if you want to try the games out, or Vanilla Legends is also a nice starting point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969693940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1391532422}
review:
It is worth noting that this format of game is older than the similar Heros of Might and Magic series.  The game mechanic is similar however, you're are controlling only one "Hero".  I guess you could consider this a sub-set of "HOMM".  Basically this version is the best of the Kings Bounty series.
It's a good looking game and although a bit repetative (aren't all RPG's), the combat still remains oddly interesting no matter how many times you do it...
It's about the best combo of Strategy and RPG around (this includes HOMM also)...  Although I have not technically reviewed it; it's a bit like the matrix...  You have to see it for yourself...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996618431', 'num_games_owned': 2910, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6427, 'last_played': 1390134654}
review: Grandissima espansione di King's Bounty: Armored Princess, aggiunge tantissime nuove quest, nuovi oggetti, nuovi incantesimi, un nuovo sistema legato all'adrenalina e tanto altro. Il gioco √® davvero bello e diventa difficile riuscire a smettere di giocarci.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027492825', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9012, 'last_played': 1707424467}
review:
Best game of its kind since Heroes of Might and Magic III back in the day.
I have sunk over 100 hours of gameplay into it and its still not boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016815299', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1355299200}
review: King's bounty plays a lot like Heroes of Might and Magic, whenever you have an encounter on the overworld you have stacked units on a hex board with turn based combat. You get a dragon that can cast a spell per turn (increased turn cooldown depending which spell you choose) and your hero character (the armored princess) can cast a spell per turn. Your hero character equips armor and weapons that change your hero's stats. The hero isn't involved in combat other than spells but your stats are attributed to your units in combat. Overall King's bounty is one of my favorite games and it is oddly addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006702778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1696, 'last_played': 1416756476}
review: Starting out I thought this game was made for the little ones.  Boy was I wrong, this game is epic.  One of my favorite strategies I have played to date, endless options, so much to see and do.  Definitely worth the price.  I love that I can customize my army with any creatures I would like, any scoll I get I can add to my spell book.  Can be as challenging or as easy as you make it.  And having a flying horse doesn't hurt either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043089288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3765, 'last_played': 1323244800}
review: Wer Heroes of M&M mag, wird hier Stunden verbringen ohne auf die Zeit zu schauen. Der Urfahrter kehrt in neuem Gewand zur√ºck und wei√ü auf Anhieb zu gefallen. Schade, dass der Text nicht gesprochen wird, aber f√ºr Fans des Genres ist dieses Game ein Muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018829111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5346, 'last_played': 1383854920}
review: Probably the best turn-based strategy game ever made. It easily wins from any of the games of the Heroes of Might and Magic series (yes, even the 4th one!!), because it has much more depth to the strategy in the game. Units have diferent abilities, each class has diferent builds for their masteries and you have many more skills to choose from during the fight, and outside of it. There is also the rage system and the pet dragon, which are both very awesome ideas that improve even more your gameplay. Its definitely worth buying, so spread it to your friends! =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198051908351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1381471595}
review:
Warning: This game is one of the biggest time sinks in the planet.

Kings bounty is what Heros of Might and Magic originated from.
Same gameplay, but instead of versing others, it is a game bade on improving one hero. Fantastic fun, although the female deigns are overtly oversexualised.
Would recommend CrossWorlds over Armoured Princess, as this version contains AP. (Which I do not know why you would play since CW is literally the same story line with more content.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038978650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3902, 'last_played': 1418749833}
review:
This game has beautiful visuals even for today's standard, real awesome musical soundtracks unlike the "generic epic crap" nowdays. Deep gameplay, highly customizable character, and a lot of strategies are involved. This game also has high replay value because items and troops are randomly generated each time you create a new game. Also the conversations are hilarious.

 Did I mention that the music is freaking poetry?

The King's Bounty series is trully a stunning work of art, a hidden gem lost in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997613087', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2420, 'last_played': 1546621745}

review: If you want to get Armored Princess, GET THIS GAME! Crossworlds has an updated version of the entire campaign of AP, so there's no point in getting Armored Princess instead of Crossworlds.
